items.content:
Software Product Owner

 
We are a closely-held web and mobile application development firm looking for a driven Product Owner.  Are you experienced in product management, Lean and Agile development methods?  Passionate about building products that customers love?  Looking for a no-politics zone to do your best work?  Mercury is the place for you!

The Work

The Product Owner will product own and help ship of a range of web and native applications including:
  • Custom business applications utilizing rich HTML5/CSS3/JavaScript-driven front ends
  • Progress Web Applications
  • Business intelligence and collaboration systems
  • iOS and Android business applications
  • Large-scale website development based on innovative creative design, highly usable custom widgets and CMSes

Skills & Requirements

The position requires proven work experience in product management with a technical background and understanding of (perhaps even hands-on experience) software development and web technologies.

The Product Owner will work within multidisciplinary Scrum teams, so strong problem-solving skills and a willingness to roll up one’s sleeves will go a long way.  The ability to research, reason and communicate recommendations to clients and executive management is crucial.

Specific requirements include the following:
  • Bachelor’s Degree favored, preferably in Business, Computer Science and/or Engineering
  • 5+ years of hands-on experience with Agile-driven software development
  • 5+ years in a professional work environment analyzing business problems, collaborating and leading teams preferred
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills are pretty darn important, too.
An affinity for caffeinated beverages and a strong meme stash won’t hurt your chances.

Some Specifics

At Mercury you will:
  • Translate product strategy into detailed user stories and prototypes
  • Collaborate with interface designers and software architects to define product vision
  • Create and prioritize product backlogs
  • Apply exact standards to ensure that high quality applications and sites are delivered
  • Represent the company with customers and guide company resources to meet their needs

What Kind of Products Will You Work On?

  • Web, mobile and collaboration applications for the Southeast's fastest growing commercial real estate firms
  • Progressive web application for one of the nation’s leading furniture retailers
  • Ecommerce, operational management and transactional reporting system for a funded late-stage startup
  • iOS, Android and PWA applications for Fortune 50 consumer products field workforce
  • Data dashboards, drill down business intelligence reports and mobile reporting for global professional services firms

How to Know If You're A Fit

If any of the following excites you, we definitely want to talk to you!
  • A Product Manager's Job
  • Mind the Product Blog
  • CRAFT
  • Someone who can explain Scrum in 10 minutes

This Is A Remote-Friendly Position

Mercury is a distributed workforce with developers and designers located throughout the United States.  We are open to applicants located anywhere in the continental United States (we find all team members being within 3 time zones of each other best for collaboration) and also Tampa Bay-based professionals.

About H1B Visas and Recruiters

At this time we are not considering the sponsorship of H1B candidates.  Also, no recruiters.  Definitely; please no recruiters.  None.  No matter how good you think your candidate is.

items.content:
Rock Star Social Media Manager

WANTED: Rock Star Social Media Process Manager With Top-Notch Process Management Skills

Are you a killer social media manager with experience increasing engagement on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram? Do you live on social media 24/7 and wouldn’t dream of being out of touch for more than a few hours? Are you primarily a people organizer, with the ability to plan a schedule and get others to stick to your timeline? Would you be psyched to manage a social media community of smart, successful women seeking dating, relationship, and confidence advice?

Well, you might be the rock star social media process manager we’re looking for.

This is a critical role on our team that requires a super organized, independent self-starter. We need you to not be shy about keeping others — even our CEO — to a schedule. If you need a lot of hand holding, you won’t be a great fit for this role. 

It’s also not a content creation role — we’re using existing content that Matthew creates, and someone else will be delivering that weekly. Your process management, organizational, and teamwork skills, as well as your flexibility, will be more important than anything in this role.

The qualities we’re looking for include:

– High level of organizational skills and ability to organize others
– Process mindset and ability to see the big picture from a linear, process-driven perspective and organize others within that
– Confidence, but no ego
– Ability to keep others on schedule, no fear in your project management skillset
– Lots of flexibility 
– High digital availability and willingness to grow with us
– Passion for and devotion to the work we do and our community
– Dependability
– Prior experience as a freelancer preferred
– Two years of social media management experience preferred (bonus points if it’s for a media personality)

Responsibilities include:

– Process managing two designers, a video editor, and our CEO to get posts planned, ready, and scheduled (we have someone else who will source & deliver content from our existing library)
– Finalizing approvals from Matthew 
– Scheduling daily posts and tweets
– Creating a social media content schedule every month 
– Helping put in place a team to review comments and respond to messages with questions about our programs
– Willingness to speak up with ideas as well as take final direction where necessary

Why Join Us?

You’ll work remotely with a good amount of flexibility. We are 100% remote, with team members based in LA, NY, the UK, Eastern Europe, and Asia. 

Make an impact – help women level-up in their relationships, self-esteem, and happiness.

Be part of a positive, upbeat team that deals with each other with respect and gratitude.

HOURS

This role starts as part-time freelance for 20 hours per week, but we are looking for someone who wants to be full time and expect the hours to grow rapidly. Given that most of our customers are in the U.S., we generally work U.S. business hours, so you should have consistent availability within 9 am - 6 pm Eastern time hours (if you’re an early bird and want to work from Pacific Time, or a night owl who wants to work from European hours, we don’t care, but we’ll need to be reliably able to reach you during these hours). You’ll need consistent availability for team video calls between the hours of 11 AM - 3 PM Eastern.

To be considered, please write a cover letter to recruiting@howtogettheguy.com as to why you’d be a good fit in the body of your email. DO NOT send a CV or other attachments (if you attach ANYTHING to it, your application will automatically not be read). We prioritize culture fit, attention to detail, and superstar-quality writing when selecting candidates. 

You’ll be interviewing with our Customer Support Lead, Courtney. Her favorite color is red, so she’d be pleased if you put that word somewhere in your subject line when sending your letter.

Looking forward to meeting you!

About Us

Were a fast growing and leading SaaS company in the dialer space. Were looking to double our growth and were looking for the right person to help us get there!

The majority of our team works remotely and works through Slack for chat and Zoom for video chats. We expect you to be online during normal work hours and it should feel just like were in the office together except you can work from home and not deal with traffic. We also have allowances for a co-working space if working from home is not ideal for you.

Requirements

Key Functional Areas of Responsibility

  • Manage, review, and perform daily account responsibilities associated with Google AdWords, Yahoo, Bing and other search platforms.
  • Maintain and monitor keyword bids, account daily and monthly budget caps, impression share, quality score and other important account metrics.
  • Manage the creation of large keyword lists.
  • Provide creative copy suggestions and graphical ad templates.
  • Manage Display network placement lists on AdWords and through other contextual advertising platforms.
  • Manage and launch Paid Media campaigns from LinkedIn, Facebook, and other sources of traffic.
  • Provide recommendations and execute strategies for keyword opportunities, campaign structuring, targeting, display network, and other facets of paid search in accordance with client goals.
  • Provide oversight and manage new paid search campaigns, ad groups, and accounts and aid in the creation of paid search marketing initiatives.
  • Provide oversight, manage, and be able to generate weekly and monthly client reporting for all major metrics, goals tracking, revenue tracking, and other paid search initiatives.

  • Communication to team and management on project development, timelines, and results.

Professional Competencies

  • Ability to think creatively, and identify and resolve problems.
  • Attention to detail and the ability to effectively multi-task in a deadline driven atmosphere.
  • High levels of integrity, autonomy, and self-motivation.
  • Excellent analytical, organizational, project management and time management skills.

Professional Skills & Qualifications

  • No less than 7 years experience in Search Engine Marketing (SEM) and Paid Search (PPC).
  • Experience with website analysis using a variety of analytics tools including Google Analytics, Supermetrics, optmyzr.

Highly preferred experience

We need a person a that will not just live in the paid search shell, we need a can do attitude and isnt afraid to learn something new on the job. If you have skills with most of the following SEM Tool Experience/Computer software, then that will be a huge plus:

RoomForTea allows young professionals, students & interns to book a room for a mid-term, flexible period (1-3 months). We find rooms in local homes & full flats and verify them, creating a safer and more affordable alternative to other rental platforms on the market. 


 


On the back of a cutting-edge digital platform that is now built-out and ready for scale, RoomForTea is ready to make a splash and grow its operations, and we are looking for a Content & Marketing intern to join us for a part-time internship and help with marketing efforts.


 


Role


 


We are looking for a high energy, creative and motivated individual with great content writing skills, who can join the team to help with Guest Marketing in particular. That means finding new channels to reach our guest target market (young professionals, interns and students), and building on current channels. This position is open to individuals with different levels of experience, and there is lots of room for creativity, but the key deliverable is to help us double bookings next quarter. 


 


Main tasks you will be involved with:


 



  • Engage with current community to increase bookings, e.g engage with guests & suggest rooms, collect feedback & reviews, encourage referrals etc.

  • Recruit & onboard new users through current & new channels

  • Create web pages with basic content about London areas & keywords

  • Create online marketing content using professional photos of our properties (e.g. instagram/facebook/twitter/pinterest posts) and create youtube videos

  • Admin tasks - book house visits, photographers, follow up on references, reviews, referrals


 


What skills do we need?


 



  • Good understanding of content marketing & social media - someone who is digitally savvy, who can create and post engaging content

  • Interest in community engagement - someone who can find and engage new users online and through partner networks

  • Advantage: a creative individual with media skills (image/video editing skills on Adobe Suite or basic editing software like Canva)

  • Great interpersonal and communication skills

  • Ability to meet targets

  • Attention to detail and good written skills


 


What traits would complement our current team?


 



  • Someone who is entrepreneurial and can generate traction even where resources are limited

  • Someone creative who likes developing ideas on their own, but equally likes being part of a team and collaborating to brainstorm on strategy

  • Someone able to manage their own time and be able to work independently

What’s in it for you?

DESCRIPTION


We’re looking for a Community Manager to be the voice of Tyk in all of our community interactions and actively promote and discuss the Tyk brand messaging, to ensure users understand our content and collect feedback, this role will be defining the ongoing strategy for community management at Tyk.


In all of this, you’ll be supported by our Marcomms team, and will check in regularly with the Support Manager We’ll work together to implement and refine our strategy. We are a remote-first team though, so it’s vital that you have a keen sense of initiative and are confident to execute plans and communicate effectively.



Responsibilities:

  • Manning currently unmanned channels to increase user engagement (Quora/Stack Overflow etc)

  • Replying to mentions and social media comments

  • Getting to know all about typical Tyk users - how they use Tyk, why they use Tyk, what they love about it, what they hate

  • Nurturing and growing the community forum

  • Creating community and ‘how to’ content based on trends and questions seen in support or on the forums

  • Creating and implementing a community advocacy programme

  • Producing relevant reporting and analysis to understand the ROI for investment in the community

  • Being the voice and advocate for the Tyk community within Tyk, working closely with the Marketing Executive - Community Content

  • Establish content themes with marketing/support team based on user need - create engaging community content to be promoted on forum/support channels, or via marketing team

  • Ensure responsiveness of Tyk on all relevant channels

  • Advocate for Tyk by demonstrating Tyk’s capabilities to a wider audience (e.g. online demos/webinars, presentations at meet-ups and/or conferences)

  • Create a suite of Community reports, agree and meet targets

  • Build ongoing relationships with Community users and clients

  • Identify leads from communications/misuse of the product




Essential Skills:



  • Must have demonstrable experience in managing community forums, ideally in a B2B technical environment

  • Demonstrable experience in user support and turning users into advocates

  • Experience creating engaging user content and content planning

  • Experience advocating for a community within an organisation

  • Ability to use a variety of systems such as Discourse, Metabase BI and Freshdesk

  • Stakeholder management skills

  • Creative, innovative and problem-solving

  • Prioritises learning and continuous improvement

  • Highly analytical

  • Good public speaker and presenter

  • Ability to work remotely with our distributed team

  • Fluent in written and spoken business-level English




Benefits


There is an attractive package based on experience and performance that includes equity. Everyone has unlimited paid holiday.


You will work with a talented, and passionate team of industry experts, who are developing a cutting-edge product that is driving change and innovation within startups and household names alike.


We’re a distributed team. Work from one of our offices during induction, once you are up to speed, you can work from home, a cafe, your mums house, wherever you get your best work done, we’ll support you in making that happen.


We are growing rapidly and are looking for team members keen to grab hold, accelerate that further and shape our future. The Tyk API Management platform is helping to drive the connected world and power new products and services. We’re changing the way that organisations connect any number of their systems and services.


Whether internal, external, public or highly encrypted systems, Tyk helps businesses drive value across the retail, finance, telecoms, healthcare, or media industries (to name just a few!) If you’ve banked online, used an app to check the news, or perhaps even driven a connected car, API’s, and by extension, Tyk, make that possible.

items.title: PPC Manager
items.content:
You’ll be taking PPC in-house for us for the first time and you’ll have total ownership of the Google Ads and Bing account, including strategy, optimisation, tracking, analysis & reporting. 


We need someone who is as passionate about the growth potential of Shift as we are. We’ve grown 10x in the last 6 months and our PPC budget has 5x too, but we know there’s a lot more to come. 


This role will operate out of the newly formed London office with some travel to our other offices required, particularly in the first few months. Salary + equity on experience.


Day-to-day you’ll:



  • Manage PPC across Shift, including strategy, launching campaigns, optimisation, tracking, analysis & reporting

  • Work with product to drive conversion of traffic on site e.g., build and run A/B tests on Landing pages

  • Anticipate and respond to competitor behaviour and industry trends

  • Help to refine our attribution methodology

  • Help to refine our bid management approach to activate new and existing users

  • Work with the wider marketing, marketplace and data teams


You’ll be a dream if you:



  • Are obsessed with your numbers and have a laser focus on CPCs, CTRs, CVRs, CPLs, CPAs and LTVs

  • Have a technical mindset with strong knowledge of tagging, tracking and attribution

  • Are highly motivated, self-starter with a positive outlook and a friendly attitude


And if you show evidence of the below, that’d be nice too:



  • Have a formidable track record running search campaigns, ideally in a marketplace, e-commerce or travel company

  • Have thorough understanding of Bid Management tools and experience of setting a successful bid management strategy

  • Managed at least six figure monthly budgets

With the rise of flexible work comes an increased demand for flexible, pay-as-you-go housing. RoomForTea allows young professionals, students & interns to book a room for a mid-term, flexible period (1-3 months). We find rooms in local homes & full flats and verify them, creating a safer and more affordable alternative to other rental platforms on the market. 


 


On the back of a cutting-edge digital platform that is now built-out and ready for scale, RoomForTea is ready to make a splash and grow its operations, and we are looking for a Content & Marketing intern to join us for a part-time internship and help with marketing efforts.


 


Role


 


We are looking for a high energy, creative and motivated individual with great content writing skills that can help with Guest Marketing in particular. That means finding new channels to reach our guest target market (young professionals, interns and students), and building on current channels. This position is open to individuals with different levels of experience, and there is lots of room for creativity, but the key deliverable is to help us double bookings next quarter. 


 


Main tasks you will be involved with:


 



  • Engage with current community to increase bookings, e.g engage with guests & suggest rooms, collect feedback & reviews, encourage referrals etc.

  • Recruit & onboard new users through current & new channels

  • Create web pages with basic content about London areas & keywords

  • Create online marketing content using professional photos of our properties (e.g. instagram/facebook/twitter/pinterest posts) and create youtube videos

  • Admin tasks - book house visits, photographers, follow up on references, reviews, referrals


 


What skills do we need?


 



  • Good understanding of content marketing & social media - someone who is digitally savvy, who can create and post engaging content

  • Interest in community engagement - someone who can find and engage new users online and through partner networks

  • Advantage: a creative individual with media skills (image/video editing skills on Adobe Suite or basic editing software like Canva)

  • Great interpersonal and communication skills

  • Ability to meet targets

  • Attention to detail and good written skills


 


What traits would complement our current team?


 



  • Someone who is entrepreneurial and can generate traction even where resources are limited

  • Someone creative who likes developing ideas on their own, but equally likes being part of a team and collaborating to brainstorm on strategy

  • Someone able to manage their own time and be able to work independently

  • Someone with a strong work ethic and a ‘can do’ attitude


 


What’s in it for you?


 



  • Fixed rate for each new guest/booking to be agreed on

  • RoomForTea booking vouchers, redeemable on any room rental on roomfortea.com

  • Flexible working arrangements and ability to work remotely

  • Opportunity to be hired as full-time employee upon completion of internship


 


To apply please send your CV and a brief statement of interest.

*What is Stasher?*
Currently present in 250 cities, Stasher is the world's first sharing economy solution for luggage storage - think of it as the Airbnb for bags. We are a platform that connects shops, hotels and businesses (we call these StashPoints) looking to monetise their excess storage space with travellers seeking to store their bags cheaply and securely. Bring those two together via an intuitive, simple, mobile-optimised web app and you have Stasher.

*As our PR and Social Media Marketing Associate you'll be...*
-Growing and maintaining the Company’s social media channels (Instagram,
Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest)
-Create and manage all publishing content, ensuring content is highly creative, relevant, original and convey our brand message.
-Analyse and monitor campaigns, continuously providing recommendations on how to further to drive brand awareness and engagement.
-Ensuring key trade and consumer press coverage
-Liaising with corporate PR teams of key partners
-Build and maintain relationships with global media outlets and key influencers across multiple channels ensuring that a positive brand image is conveyed at all times
-Manage Stasher’s Bloggers and Influencers program

*The right candidate will...*
- Have an understanding of how the PR ecosystem works, how to draft a press release and pitch to journalists
- Be highly creative and hands-on, eager to get stuck in and juggle multiple projects
- Have demonstrable experience growing a social media following
- Be open to learning new skills - we are happy to allow time for this!

*Nice to have…*
Photoshop and In-design skills, alternatively know how to use Canva

*On offer...*
Here's a list of the main perks & benefits of working at Stasher, aside from the obvious ones involved with working in a fast-growing start-up!
- A competitive base salary
- Flexible WFH/Remote working scheme
- Comfortable equipment budget to kit out your desk
- Free fruit and lots of snacks everyday in our Shoreditch office + Friday breakfast/coffee morning and drinks
- Regular team socials and team summits (when we get together with our remote workers)
- 25 days holiday + 1 day for each year you're with us
- Opportunity for unpaid leave for additional holidays
- Learning budget
- Matched pension contributions with Nest
- Cycle-to-work and Tech-at-work schemes

items.title: Special Projects: Growth and Engagement
items.content:
About Apolitical


Apolitical is the first global peer-to-peer platform for government, helping public servants find the ideas, experts and partners they need to solve the hardest challenges facing our societies. Our network is used in more than 170 countries, including by mayors, ministers and former heads of state.


 


The role


If you like to move at pace on multiple tasks, take projects from design to execution and evaluation, have a flair for messaging and engaging audiences, this role in the area of community engagement/ communications/ online events might be perfect for you. 


As we continue to promote Apolitical to a diverse range of public servants across geography and roles, Apolitical needs to grow and engage certain sub-audiences of public servants more deeply at certain times. This may be because an upcoming offering is especially relevant to them, we have a partnership focussing on a specific sector, or we may be rolling out in new languages.


Apolitical is looking for someone to grow and engage these specific sub-communities. Engagement interventions might look like online events, learning activities, and competitions, amongst other ideas. This is a company critical function that is, for the first time being brought together as one person’s job, allowing the role-holder to individually own this goal while working closely with other teams across the company. 


Prior experience is not necessary but concrete evidence of the desired skills is. This is likely to be a suitable role for someone of up to 3 years experience, but will vary by individual.


 


Your key activities will involve: 



  • (15%) Researching policy challenges (the key issues, organisations, people) to support all your growth and engagement activity like generating ideas, writing messaging, finding speakers and participants, and liaising confidently with high profile public servants, academics, and practitioners.

  • (5%) Design of ‘community’ interventions to achieve the targeted growth and engagement goals.

  • (20%) Writing messaging to communicate the significance of a policy issue in a concise and engaging way, and setting up engaging email communications.

  • (30%) Executing on interventions (eg. like online events, learning experiences, interactive content).

  • (25%) Ringleading the activation of distribution channels across the company to promote an intervention or reach the required audience – like third party distribution partners, social media, and engaging our community.

  • (5%) Tracking and evaluation of your interventions.


 


 


Who we are looking for – 


You have these essential traits which you will further hone in the role: 



  • Creative – You enjoy thinking of new ways to engage identified groups.

  • Strategic – Your ideas match the reality of the resources available to you. You can see how others’ work can support your goals.

  • Organised and attentive executor and project manager – You enjoy zooming in and  executing on multiple projects, as well as zooming out (being strategic). 

  • Excellent communicator – Your communication is persuasive and compelling. You can credibly communicate with seniors. You are great at working with other teams.

  • Data and goal driven – You enjoy assessing the effectiveness of your effort by analysing data. 

  • Passion -You are enthusiastic about i) building and engaging specific audiences through digital methods, and ii) learning about policy and the public service.


 


In addition you will develop skills in: 



  • Using email software, like Hubspot

  • Basic coding

  • Running effective experiments and build a new function in a startup

  • Building online communities

  • Public speaking and moderation (through preparing the speakers and moderators, and possibly, in the future leading online events yourself)

items.content:
City Ambassador / Online Marketer

Marketing
Anywhere
commission
Company: Tutor For All
Freelance

Overview

Tutor for All is looking for City Ambassadors in top cities throughout the U.S to recruit students in middle and high school for our online tutoring services. This role would be perfect for someone who has a network of people who would be interested in an online tutoring service or someone who knows how to market online. This is also the perfect opportunity for an influencer who has followers who would be interested in our tutoring service.

Ambassadors will connect with schools, parents and students understand their education needs and connect them with our Tutors. In addition Ambassadors will make connections with organizations and communities who need tutoring but can’t pay for them, establishing connections with them and partnerships to provide free tutoring to those in need.

The most important characteristic of a outstanding ambassador is someone who believes in the importance of providing all students with exceptional education and is willing to reach out and connect with people of different socioeconomic statuses to push and recruit people for that mission.

Ambassadors are extroverts with charming personalities able to communicate exceptionally in person, over the phone and via email. We measure our success by how many students sign up for the platform, this is also reflected in ambassador compensation.

You’re Awesome At: Connecting with people Working remotely and independently Written and verbal communication in English Corresponding via email professionally





Responsibility and Duties: Skilled in social media and able to communicate information about our services online effectively (e.g. social media and forums) Generate, share, and reply to online reviews in a positive and open manner Network and gain the trust of potential customers and partners Understand our services; fully inform potential customers Utilize word-of-mouth marketing techniques, such as referral incentive programs Aid in the organizing of marketing events Provide feedback to the marketing regarding customers’ insights and questions








Perfect Candidate: Someone who is currently or has recently, worked with children. Someone who is looking for additional income. Someone who would be able to provide feedback on marketing and operations to better our efforts to teach children. Someone who is already in the field of tutoring and looking to expand their practice. Someone whose a consultant in the education industry.






How to Apply: Email (contact@tutorforall.online) your resume and a brief blurb on what your strategy would be to market our service to your network. If you plan to market this service online as a online marketer, then please confirm who would be your target audience and what platforms/strategies you plan to use.


This insight would help us better understand your strategy and when we plan our interview, we can discuss further. We plan to help you become successful in this role, but we also need you to have a plan.

 



To apply for this job please send your job application to the email below.

Please reference Jobspresso in your application, so that remote companies know where their best candidates are coming from

contact@tutorforall.online

items.content:
Our market leading hospitality API platform provides software and hardware companies with fast and secure access to data from hotels. We're looking for a Technical Product Manager to join our team to lead the development of our data acquisition products. These are tools that are used internally by our integrations and engineering team to acquire the data that powers our API.


As a Technical Product Manager at Impala, you'll:





  • Have responsibility for the further development of existing tools as well as the development of new technologies that make data acquisition easier and quicker.

  • Ensure that the engineers on your team are well prioritised and are working on what's important.

  • Develop our acquisition product suite so that they continue to lead the market in security and speed.

  • Work with our Head of Product and wider product team to establish best practices across teams.

  • Have a major say in the future development of Impala products.


What we're looking for:



  • Great communication skills, you must speak and write clearly.

  • Significant experience managing technical products.

  • An understanding of Robotic Process Automation and common database technologies.

  • A first class intellect.


What would make you stand out:



  • Experience within hospitality or travel technology.

  • An engineering or solutions engineering background.







About Impala



Impala is a team of eleven incredibly talented, helpful and outgoing individuals (plus one more modest individual that wrote this job post) based in London (with a remote engineering team). We’re a diverse team that puts building a great product and being happy at work as our two guiding principles. We're also very well funded by industry leading investors.


What we offer:



  • A competitive salary and equity based on experience.

  • Frequent socials.

  • Flexible working hours.

  • Time dedicated every Friday afternoon for personal projects, lightning talks and team events.

  • A monthly allowance for books and other educational materials.

  • The opportunity to work alongside a tight knit and driven team.


Where we differ is:



  • You'll be working in a company that puts professional development front and centre.

  • We'll listen to you. We're hiring you for your knowledge and experience and we intend to put that to work.

  • We have an incredible culture and community.

Digital Content Specialist at Skillcrush

Remote | International

Full-Time in Worldwide – Remote OK

Skillcrush is on the hunt for a Digital Content Specialist to join our team! This is a full-time, mid-career role for someone with excellent writing skills, experience writing about technology, and the ability to spot trends in audience data and plan content around trending topics.

As the Digital Content Specialist on our marketing team, you’ll spend most of your time pitching, researching, and writing articles for the Skillcrush blog. In addition to these responsibilities, you’ll be creating content for social media, newsletters, webinars, videos, etc. Plus you’ll work with the team to track and help develop site traffic and contribute ideas and content for other marketing campaigns.

The ideal candidate for the Digital Content Specialist role should have experience with both SEO strategy and SEO writing. You also excel at researching strategic article topics and related keywords, conducting research and interviews, and writing and editing copy specifically for the web. You should be a self-starter who can take projects and run with them—but you also know when to ask for help or feedback, and you respect a good edit.

Possessing tech skills (coding, visual design, or UX/UI, for example) is a bonus, as is experience with email marketing.

Responsibilities

  • Own the editorial calendar
  • Research and pitch article ideas in editorial meetings
  • Write, according to Skillcrush voice and tone guidelines, at least three SEO-optimized and/or interview-based feature articles per week—including a mix of longer features and shorter action-oriented roundups
  • Edit and improve articles from our archive to increase search rankings
  • Self-edit posts before submitting to Head of Content Marketing
  • Upload and format content in WordPress, coordinate with team designer on custom graphics, and schedule posts
  • Oversee weekly newsletters, including selecting articles to promote, writing email copy, and planning and conducting AB tests to increase open rates and CTRs
  • Write e-guides, webinar and video scripts, and other non-editorial content, as needed
  • Work with the Head of Content Marketing on content strategy, including pitching ideas for marketing spikes and other quarterly content campaigns
  • Report on and deliver recommendations for improving site traffic, specifically high-quality organic traffic
  • Keep updated on tech news and trends and follow cultural movements and news relevant to our audience

Requirements

  • Background in writing and editing, specifically for the web or other digital platforms
  • Experience with SEO strategy and SEO writing, including working with one or more SEO tools (ahrefs, SEMRush, Moz, etc.)
  • Experience working with a content management system like WordPress, and enough familiarity with HTML and CSS that when article formatting breaks, you’ve got it covered!
  • Experience with email copywriting, copyediting, and general email marketing best practices
  • A live or die by the numbers mentality (You love user interviews, planning content based on traffic numbers and reader engagement, etc., and the thrill of recognizing patterns and trends they can leverage to improve site traffic.)
  • General knowledge of Google Sheets/Excel in order to report on site traffic and manage the editorial calendar
  • Comfort working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment while contributing to a positive and supportive culture
  • Availability to work a flexible range of hours that generally overlaps with standard business hours (9am-5pm) on US Eastern Time
  • Access to a reliable, high-speed Internet connection

Bonuses

  • Tech skills, such as coding, visual design, UX/UI, etc.
  • Experience working with email marketing and platforms, ideally HubSpot
  • Experience working on an Agile or scrum team
  • Experience working remotely with team members in different time zones

Perks and Benefits

  • Flexible, remote work
  • Three weeks of paid vacation
  • Competitive healthcare benefits, including fully covered insurance for you and subsidized insurance for your family
  • Eight weeks of paid leave for new parents, and an additional eight weeks unpaid
  • 401k plan with 4% match and no vesting time
  • Professional development stipend
  • Co-working stipend
  • Free access to all the Skillcrush classes you can eat
  • A fun, passionate team working from all over the world
  • A fast-growing company with lots of opportunities for job growth

Pay Range

  • $60-70k, commensurate with skills and experience

About Skillcrush

Skillcrush is an online tech education company that offers online classes on a variety of technical topics.

At Skillcrush, we have built an open and cooperative environment. We hire who we want to work with, but also love people think differently than us and challenge the status quo. We empower our staff, giving them the support and autonomy they need to succeed. We embrace data to make decisions and overcome obstacles. We do what we do well, but we’re also always looking to do it better.

Skillcrush is an equal opportunity employer and evaluates applicants regardless of their age, race, color, gender, religion, national origin (or current home base), sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, family status, time zone, geography, musical preferences, or college football allegiances. We think a diverse team builds a better product,a better company, and ultimately, a better world!

Although based in New York City, the Skillcrush team is a fully remote company and welcomes job applicants from all over the world.

Tax Expert Lead at Intuit

Remote

Seasonal, Remote

2019-10729

Locations: USA Remote

Overview

If you’re highly motivated individual with active credentials and excellent communication skills, we need your help in leading a team of tax support agents. Our support agents will be helping customers navigate through the TurboTax experience and assist with technology. We need a leader that the support agents can turn to for assistance and growth. You’ll advance our goal of “doing the nation’s taxes” by providing product guidance and tax support to our agents as they navigate, research and assist customers through the TurboTax experience. You’ll also play an important role in our effort to enhance our brand by creating Turbo Tax “net promoters.”

Check out these videos and find out what it’s like to work as a Tax Advisor for Intuit: http://bitly.com/pY7stu

Responsibilities

JOB CONTENT AND SCOPE

  • Ask a Tax Expert Lead is responsible for Providing live support for our Ask a Tax Expert agents.

TYPICAL DELIVERABLES:

  • Accurate Tax Advice to Seasonal Agents during tax season.
  • Assist ATE Managers with team responsibilities.
  • Accurate Help Desk answers to agent inquiries.
  • Accurate time tracking for hours spent in each functional area.
  • Monitor agents to ensure compliance with IRS and other agency requirements regarding Tax Advice or Audit Support.
  • Flexibility to work overtime hours when required during tax season.
  • Work under pressure of meeting team productivity goals. Successful candidates must be willing to flex to meet team goals.

Qualifications

TEAM / LEADERSHIP SKILLS:

  • Demonstrates a sincere desire for a quality user experience and understands the impact of “Net Promoters”
  • Flexible team player attitude
  • Promotes/fosters a positive work environment
  • Maintains positive working relationships
  • Positive, flexible approach to change
  • Collaborative approach to problem-solving
  • Understands individual impact on team’s success

ANALYTICAL SKILLS:

  • Able to research, analyze and determine an appropriate course of action in a variety of situations
  • Able to research IRS and state publications, regulations, and GAAP publications
  • Excellent numerical, abstract and verbal reasoning skills• Solves moderately complex problems exercising good judgment

KNOWLEDGE / BACKGROUND EXPERIENCE:

  • Must possess one of the following: Active EA Certification or CPA
  • 2+ years management experience
  • Extensive knowledge of tax laws
  • In-depth understanding of tax concepts and processes desired
  • Experience using major tax preparation software; Experience with electronic filing a plus.
  • Experience preparing federal and state returns either individual (1040) or business (1120, 1120S, 1065, 1041)
  • Experience providing support in a technical PC environment a plus

Online Communications Manager at UltraViolet

Remote

Location: (Multiple states)

Department: Campaigns Team

Type: Full Time

Min. Experience: Experienced

UltraViolet is hiring an Online Communications Manager to help us create a real cost for sexism in the U.S.

About UltraViolet:

In 2012, UltraViolet was launched to harness the collective power of millions of people to advance women’s equity through rapid-response digital organizing.

Since then, UltraViolet has been the premier national organization elevating all of the issues that impact women’s lives across identity–from intimate partner and state violence to health care to economic policy–to a national audience. Our goal has been to prove that sexism and rape culture exist by using rapid-response campaigns to expose the impact of the problems on women’s lives, create public accountability, and advocate for solutions.

To do that, over the last seven years, we’ve built and are sustaining a community of 1.2 million committed and engaged activists in every state and congressional district across the country and ignited a new wave of feminist activism.

Moving ahead, UltraViolet will focus on building an intersectional feminist community online by creating compelling stories and offering ways to take action that center the voices and perspectives of women of color, Indigenous women, and LGBTQ people. It is these stories–from our members and our staff–that will drive demand for the kind of changes women need.

If fighting for a world beyond patriarchy, where people of all backgrounds and identities thrive with freedom and dignity, is your passion–UltraViolet is the organization for you!

UltraViolet is an organization run by women, immigrants, people of color, Indigenous women, and LGBTQ people. Sexism disparately impacts us, and we strongly encourage people from these and other impacted communities to apply.

Job Description:

UltraViolet is wrapping up a multi-month strategic planning process that is shifting the direction of the organization from a singular focus on large-scale digital organizing to a more specific focus on culture change work and talking to politically unengaged women, in conjunction with running robust digital campaigns on issues that impact the lives of women.

  • The UltraViolet Online Communications Manager will work with the Senior Online Communications Director to grow the UltraViolet following on social media by curating and creating highly-engaging content through analytics-based experimentation.
  • The Online Communications Manager will be responsible for setting and meeting ambitious growth and engagement goals on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and other social media sites. In addition, the Online Communications Manager will be responsible for helping maintain the UltraViolet website.

These are the required skills for this position:

  • Experience working in intersectional feminist organizing and/or racial justice organizing
  • Proven writing ability in a fast-paced setting (you are excited by the idea of having to explain something complex in a tweet)
  • Graphic design skills and experience with Photoshop, Canva, or similar design tool
  • Experience creating live content, including video
  • Experience using a social media management tool such as Hootsuite, Sprout, Later, ActionSprout, CrowdTangle, TweetDeck, etc.

We’re hoping you’ll bring one or two (or more) of these bonus skills:

  • Comfortable on camera, as well as behind, and/or narrating live events
  • Experience fundraising on social media
  • Experience with paid social media campaigns
  • Experience reaching out to and engaging influencers
  • Basic website skills (HTML or WordPress experience specifically)

You will thrive in this role if you’re someone who:

  • Likes the idea of working remotely, since we are an all-remote organization
  • Is comfortable juggling multiple tasks and can thrive in a fast-paced environment, independently and as part of a team
  • Is an excellent project manager and can manage a project seamlessly from start to finish
  • Is able, willing, and excited to turn on a dime when opportunity knocks

Perks of working for UltraViolet:

  • Full health, dental, and vision for employees and generous coverage for your family
  • Four to six weeks of vacation and 12 paid holidays
  • 401(k) with a 5% employer contribution
  • Sixteen weeks of parental leave, plus support for childcare for work-related events and travel
  • A team with a top-notch GIF game and a #pets slack channel, that gets surprise presents (sometimes purple cakes!), and knows how to have fun while getting a lot done in a low-ego environment

Salary:

The salary range for this position is $60,000 to $70,000, plus a home office stipend based on the cost of living in your location.

UltraViolet is an equal employment opportunity employer and does not discriminate against applicants or employees because of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, citizenship status, disability status, genetic information, sexual orientation, or gender identity or expression of an otherwise qualified individual, or membership in any other class protected by applicable law. UltraViolet hires and promotes individuals on the basis of their qualifications for the job to be filled. We strongly encourage diverse applicants to apply.

items.title: Senior Product Manager
items.content:
Senior Product Manager at Abstract

Remote

US-based remote or SF office

About Abstract
Abstract is a design workflow platform for teams to version, manage, and collaborate on Sketch files. Since launching in July 2017, over 5,000 design teams across 75 countries have adopted Abstract, including teams from Shopify, Cisco, Intuit, Spotify, Salesforce, Instacart, OpenTable, and more.

At Abstract, we are actively working to build a diverse and inclusive organization. Here, diversity includes age, economic class, educational background, ethnic variance, familial status, gender, gender expression, gender identity, marital status, national origin, religious affiliation, sex, sexual orientation, transgender status, or veteran status.

Abstract is headquartered in San Francisco but many of our teams and roles are remote-first (US-based only at this time). If you have a passion for rolling up your sleeves, building new programs, and have a strong, team-player mentality, we’d love to hear from you!

About the Role
As a Senior Product Manager at Abstract, you will have a unique opportunity to shape how thousands of companies work together, including our own. You’ll make an impact on our Files Squad by leading product development for new design tool integrations (Adobe XD) and expanding the Abstract platform to support a diverse set of designers and workflows.

What you’ll do:

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to plan, build, and ship high-quality solutions to our customers.
  • Define the Roadmap for your Squad and prioritize projects based on strategic goals and customer impact. Propose objectives and KPIs that focus your team’s efforts and align vision with company goals.
  • Clarify the problem to solve, project goals, decision-making roles, and document expectations from stakeholders and transition into an effective kick-off with the Squad.
  • Generate hypotheses for solving problems and validate the approaches with customers by interviewing, analyzing data, and offering early access to features in development.
  • Partner with Engineering and Design to scope out solutions and plan development milestones. Proactively identify the dependencies, constraints, and risks to the plan and be willing to adapt and guide your team through change based on new information.
  • Identify gaps or ambiguous workflows and frame them as opportunities for process improvements that make the broader Product organization more efficient. Drive progress pragmatically and create bridges for people to get from here to there without disruptions.
  • Partner with Marketing, Sales, and Support to identify product opportunities, craft impactful narratives, and bring products to market effectively.
  • Continually evaluate whether or not our shipped solutions have solved the problem through quantitative and qualitative analysis. Summarize the results using approachable language and a framework for evaluating success.

What you’ll bring:

  • You have a growth mindset. You realize you don’t have all the answers and enjoy pushing through moments of uncertainty on the path to discovery.
  • You are an active, empathetic listener. You seek to understand the problems people face, how they feel, and the goals they want to achieve.
  • You can synthesize a myriad of possibilities, considerations, and questions into a series of productive decisions-to-be-made and facilitate answering them collaboratively.
  • You are an excellent written and oral communicator that strives for clarity.
  • You are fulfilled by mentoring your teammates and encouraging them to work together deliberately, especially in moments of ambiguity or tension.
  • You define what success looks like and prioritize solutions based on customer impact.
  • You have significant experience with design systems and tools like Sketch and Adobe XD. You can describe how design workflows weave through the ecosystem today and are excited to collaborate and shape what’s on the horizon.
  • You conduct user research and design experiments to discover opportunities, explore solutions, and make the best decisions for the customer experience.
  • You have experience developing software in a complex web/native application environment and have experience integrating systems and tools.
  • You learn new concepts quickly and can switch between creative and analytical thinking.
  • You have experience working within a variety of product development methodologies (Agile, SCRUM, Lean, etc.), environments, and industries.

Benefits
At Abstract, we offer resources that emphasize personal and familial wellbeing. We provide 99% healthcare coverage, including dental, vision, and life insurance. We offer 10 weeks parental leave, unlimited paid-time off, and flexible working arrangements. Additional perks include dependent care and health care FSA as well as commuter benefits for SF office employees.

To help employees plan for the future, we’re able to offer competitive pay and a 401k.

We are a distributed team and we are able to offer US-based remote employment for most roles. We offer travel opportunities for company meetings, team meet-ups, and the occasional conference.

Notes
Though we’re a distributed team, we’re currently only able to hire US-based candidates.

As part of our security protocols, offers are contingent on successful completion of a background check.

Apply for job

items.content:
Location


Based in London but scope for travelling across the UK and Europe. Adventure awaits.


Purpose


We want to give people the freedom to access the world’s best work spaces, anywhere, any time, at the touch of a button. 


We’re looking for a positive, energetic, natural sales-person (that ideally has a bit of experience in HR) to grow our community of freelancers, startups, and small teams customers. 


Employment Type


Full-time


People


Desana gives people access to a network of great work space when they want it, where they want it, through a single monthly subscription.


We’re a growing startup based between London, Edinburgh, and Stockholm. We aim to become a globally relevant company by disrupting the way people think about, and access, the places they work. We're looking for the best people to join us on our journey.


With prior experience in startups ourselves, we’re keen to do things the right way from the very start. That’s why we believe in openness and transparency in everything we do, from salary to communications, to processes.


Why Join Us?


We’re about to push workspace transformation another notch in an industry that is already undergoing tremendous change and significant growth. Join us to not only grow the network of customers that are already changing the ways they work, but by living and breathing that transformation as you work flexibly, autonomously, and (as much as the job demands) remotely yourself. We pride ourselves in radical open-ness and strive to create a company that fulfills its users, partners, and employees. Always.


The Role


We’re passionate about building the best possible customer on-boarding experience and relationships for the long-term. We’re not passionate about incessant cold-calls and unrealistic sales targets.


Sales



  • Defining, establishing, growing, and optimising effective consumer considerate B2B and B2C sales channels. 

  • Identifying and building relationships with leads within each channel.

  • Successfully onboarding customers to our platform, taking time to manually support their needs as necessary. 

  • Recognising differences in customer needs, building and implementing effective systems to support consumer groups. Continuously optimising these systems.

  • Working with the team to prepare marketing materials that will help you to successfully onboard customers. 

  • Spend time identifying potential partnership opportunities through which customers can be reached. Nurturing those opportunity relationships for long-term mutual benefit.

  • Presenting engaging and informative sales updates / strategies to the rest of the team. 

  • Attending national and international industry events to better understand our industry and to meet prospective customers.

  • Creating and delivering result orientated “sprints” (short, task defined projects) that are aligned with the company’s 6 and 12 month goals.


Communication



  • Working directly with space relationship managers (and the rest of the team) to incessantly improve customer experience. 

  • Regular monitoring and updating of our task management system.

  • Participate in the daily whole team “stand up” call, wherever you are.


Industry Awareness 



  • Consistently develop wider awareness of customer segment needs; meticulous attention to specific needs of customers. 

  • Staying on top of industry news and trends; be able to identify and respond to micro-indicators of change.


Relationship Management



  • Managing and nurturing relationships with stakeholders, customer groups, and individuals. 

  • Encourage everyone to get the best out of the platform (and help them), so that we can develop the best possible customer experience. 


About You



  • You have demonstrable sales experience: preferably in building face-to-face, long-lasting relationships with different customer segment groups. You should be able to demonstrate that you’ve applied effective on-boarding systems to previous sales roles and that you understand where there may be scope for optimisation.

  • You have had exposure to HR roles: not vital but we're looking for someone that can relate to the challenges teams face, particularly from a remote working / staff retention perspective. If you have HR experience please tell us about it.

  • You have CRM experience: we use Hubspot, but anything else is fine too.

  • You’re personable: a fun, enthusiastic people-person that finds joy in connecting with and learning from others.

  • You can communicate diligently: you understand the importance of maintaining regular communication with our customers and those that you are working to onboard, while never being too pushy.

  • You’re never complacent: you strive to recognise that things can always be better than they currently are and have the confidence to present solutions to any weaknesses or inefficiencies that you see.

  • You’re driven: you should be self-starting and enjoy having autonomy (with accountability to the rest of the team), able to manage your own time and effectively plan your day to day activities and consistently maintain customer interactions in our CRM database.

  • You have a growth mindset: a desire to grow both personally and professionally.


Desana benefits



  • Share options in the business.

  • Flexible and remote work hours with a strong focus on work-life balance.

  • We’re establishing complete salary transparency across the company with clear progression paths.

  • Team drinks, events and trips.

  • Free access to the app and our network of workspaces.


Think you’re the right person for the role? Apply now.

items.title: Digital Strategist
items.content:
Digital Strategist at Firefly Partners

Remote

Client Services

This is a full-time, remote position. We will only review applications from qualified candidates located in and eligible to work in the United States.

Firefly is looking for a passionate, engaging Digital Strategist to join our growing team.

What We’re Seeking

If you’re skilled at working with clients to understand their digital goals, opportunities, and challenges and developing results-focused digital marketing strategies to meet those identified needs, then we want to hear from you! You must enjoy working collaboratively with clients and team members, but also be detail-oriented when it comes to managing associated budgets, timelines, and scopes of work. And in an ever-changing digital landscape, you must bring a passion for staying up-to-date on digital marketing and nonprofit technology trends.

In this role, we expect you to bring the following qualities:

  • Staying apprised of and analyzing digital marketing trends and technologies
  • Developing and executing results-focused digital marketing strategies for clients
  • Developing and maintaining long-term client relationships
  • Managing budgets, scopes, and timelines as needed

Some of What You’ll Do

  • Facilitate discovery sessions with clients to identify their digital needs, goals, opportunities, and challenges. Help cross-functional teams develop solutions that are true to the organization’s brand, goals, and supporter needs.
  • Develop, execute, and monitor strategic plans and multi-channel marketing campaigns. Align client and Firefly resources, as needed, to meet established digital goals.
  • Establish processes for measuring and evaluating the success of individual campaigns as well as strategic plans. Evaluate the results of campaigns and appropriately present results and recommendations to clients.
  • Act as Project Manager for a set of client projects or support engagements. Manage budget, timeline, scope, and deliverables for those engagements. Manage changes to client budgets, timelines, and scopes using established Firefly processes and with a focus on client satisfaction.
  • Build strong, collaborative relationships with clients and maintain those relationships over time. Adapt communication styles and methods to build trust among clients and partners.
  • Collaborate with project managers, designers, developers, production specialists, and other subject matter experts to produce deliverables that are of the highest quality.
  • Proactively recognize and assess client and team needs and prepare potential solutions to meet those needs. Where necessary, lead on the documentation and implementation of solutions.

DESCRIPTION


ABOUT US


Disperse is a VC-backed artificial intelligence construction startup focused on improving the productivity of project teams, with the help of computer vision. Our goal is to ultimately re-imagine the way building projects are planned, delivered and operated.


Over the past year, our three offices (London - HQ, Sarajevo, and Yerevan) have joined forces to build a product and service that our customers love. Now, we’re kickstarting our growth across the pond in New York with our newest clients, Tiffany & Co and Aecom Tishman.


We have ambitions to expand significantly, which means that we are looking for passionate and enthusiastic talent to join our proudly diverse, international team.


YOUR ROLE


There is no better time to join our growing team, as you will have the rare opportunity to establish yourself as first Product Marketing leader and a core part of our US founding team in New York. The idea is to build out a team that connects the dots between a fantastic product and huge growth potential. Productivity in construction is an age-old problem with enormous opportunity and we’re looking for someone ambitious, smart and versatile to help us unlock it. As we expand domestically and globally, the Product Marketing team has a critical role in supporting and enabling our growth.


We organise the Product Marketing team into two parts, focusing on different core outcomes:


Product Success: Customers understand the problems we solve and the value they get from our products and solutions.


Commercial Success: ensuring that we have clearly differentiated value propositions for key audiences, and that our Sales team and Champions in our customers’ organisations have the tools they need to position and sell easily.


The role will be based in New York with an initial 6-week on-boarding in London and regular travel to the UK and Europe.



  • Lead GTM: Define and lead go-to-market strategy and execution – Build the launch strategy and lead a cross-functional team to see it through to execution

  • Define Positioning: Decide on how we position our product in the market and how we message it strategically to different customer cohorts, buyers and user groups

  • Lead product marketing efforts: help define the overall market narrative, construct target customer profiles, generate customer case studies and other collateral to support marketing and sales initiatives, and guide communication efforts across multiple audiences and channels

  • Drive inbound product marketing - Be the voice of the market through industry research, competitive analysis, quantitative analysis, and structured qualitative feedback from businesses through direct engagement.

  • Content Lead: Set priorities for the content production backlog and drive changes to the marketing website, and ensure the availability of high-quality product collateral; produce high fidelity externally-facing content including thought leadership content, customer stories, webinars, data sheets, solution guides, and more for all funnel stages

  • Lead Research: Research key market and product data, conduct user interviews to understand key customer segments, their specific needs, and lifecycle stages

  • Sales Enablement: Support the sales team by researching and documenting typical customer use cases and proof points, target buyer profiles, and

  • Develop innovative marketing strategies to gain C-level and VP mindshare.

  • Champion the product messaging and positioning internally, ensuring not only the commercial side of the business is knowledgeable about product and messaging (everyone represents the Disperse brand)


OUR CULTURE


Ask anyone at Disperse what they love most about working here, and they'll probably tell you "it's the people!", "the team, of course", "the people and the Hedwig owls in the offices".


As clichéd as it may sound, we're very proud of the people we have and the close-knit, family culture we've built across London, Sarajevo and Yerevan. Despite the distances, we're united through the passion with which we approach our goals and the fun that we have along the way. We always look out for each other, no matter what. The following should give you a good idea what type of culture you'd be joining:



  • We encourage proactivity and taking full ownership of problems and initiatives. We don't believe in micromanagement. Instead, we let you pave your own path and give you the space to continuously learn and grow even if it means taking a few detours.

  • We support each other. If a process breaks or if you're struggling, you can always count on the people around you and the people far away from you, to help you get back on track.

  • We run on feedback: direct and transparent praise and constructive criticism, communicated with the best of intentions. There is no other way to learn!

  • Ideas and approaches are always judged on merit rather than source. We welcome discussions and challenges. This way everyone makes a tremendous impact no matter the role.




REQUIREMENTS


Although previous product marketing experience is not an absolute requirement, it certainly helps if you’ve positioned and messaged enterprise products before.


We do not currently sponsor work visas for this role, therefore US citizenship or a green card are required from all applicants.



  • You have a proven track record of delivering tangible results in a product marketing within a B2B technology organisation

  • You have been working as a Product Marketing Manager between 3 to 5 years or have demonstrated experience from a similar field

  • You have experience of working collaboratively as part of cross-functional teams to take products to market

  • You understand what the component parts are, and how to determine them, for a go-to-market strategy.

  • You have led projects to gain insight from customers, and understand how to translate this into useful feedback for Business Development, Marketing and Product teams.

  • You have a customer service orientation and experience in a client-facing capacity


Your skills



  • You are able to think critically about why having a great product alone is not enough to succeed

  • You are comfortable converting complex concepts into clear, engaging messages for internal and external audiences.

  • You enjoy tackling challenging problems to ensure continuous improvement.

  • You are action-orientated and enjoy making an impact.

  • You are comfortable interpreting data and using it to inform decision making.

  • You enjoy driving projects from planning and strategy through to execution and analysis of results.

  • You are passionate about technology and its ability to solve complex problems




BENEFITS



  • Competitive Salary and generous option package

  • Private health insurance.

  • 25 days’ holiday plus all federal holidays.

  • Friendly, open and transparent culture.

  • You'll get to join a passionate startup with proven traction on its international scaling journey.

  • Flexible working hours / ability to work from home.

  • Free coffee.

  • Regular travel to the UK and Europe.

  • Regular socials, and team retreats to amazing destinations (Tbilisi, Kiev... Where next?)


Disperse welcomes applications from all sections of society. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.


THE PROCESS


The interview process will involve:



  1. Initial 30-minute conversation to get to know you

  2. 1-hour on-site interview: with members of the product, marketing and commercial team

  3. Take home task to understand your problem solving skills and style

  4. 1.5-hour on-site interview with teams: presentation of home task with Q&A, followed by technical and cultural chats with different members of the team

  5. 1-hour on-site interview with different members of the team


This process should take up to two weeks, depending on diaries. Please note that if you are not currently based in London or New York, we would be happy to speak with you over video chat.

Remote

Category: Clinical Documentation – Clinical Documentation

Pos. Type: Full Time

Company Overview

Nuance Communications, Inc. is the pioneer and leader in conversational AI innovations that bring intelligence to everyday work and life. The company delivers solutions that understand, analyze and respond to human language, amplifying human intelligence. With decades of domain and artificial intelligence expertise, Nuance works with thousands of organizations – in healthcare, telecommunications, automotive, financial services, retail, and more – to create stronger relationships and better experiences for their customers.

Join our Healthcare team…caring for clinicians the way they care for patients. Beyond words. We create technology that lets clinicians capture and document care quickly and easily so they can focus their attention on their patients

Job Summary

Position summary:

This role reports to Healthcare Research and Development Senior Content Manager and provides subject matter expertise to develop and evaluate evidence based Artificial Intelligence (AI) clinical software products.

Principal duties and responsibilities:

  • Conducts retrospective patient case reviews of automated Clinical Documentation Improvement (CDI) queries
  • Actively participates and contributes to Nuance Healthcare Research for CDI advanced practice software development.
  • Identifies when automated queries are either absent, not stated in appropriate terminology, or are not appropriately recorded.
  • Reviews patient cases to capture and label specific human language terms for clinical conditions, treatments, measurements and other evidence that supports Nuance AI clinical software development.
  • Provides training and consultation for team members, software developers, physicians and product managers.
  • Maintains a strong background in APR-DRG’s, MS-DRG’s, ICD-10 codes, coding guidelines and Coding Clinics as well as Medicare and other government billing specifications.

Knowledge, skills and qualifications –

Education:

  • Registered Nurse licensure in the US State residency.
  • CCDS (Certified Clinical Documentation Specialist or CDIP (Clinical Documentation Improvement Practitioner) certification preferred.
  • Bachelor’s degree in nursing required.

Minimum years of work experience:

  • 3 years Inpatient bedside nursing
  • 2 years’ experience with Nuance Clinical Documentation Improvement software.

Required skills:

  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment with a cross functional team of clinicians, product managers, interface designers, consultants, delivery staff, and engineers as well as clients.
  • Proven verbal and written communication skills, including presenting and/or facilitating training sessions.
  • Superior analytical abilities: ability to draw insight from findings and understand the root cause of product quality issues.
  • Team-oriented but also highly self-sufficient and self-motivated.
  • Knowledge of APR-DRG’s, MS-DRG’s, ICD-10 codes, HCCs.
  • Comfortable with Microsoft Office products including Outlook, Word and Excel.
  • Possess knowledge of workflow processes and clinical systems used in hospitals.

Preferred skills:

  • Master’s Degree in Nursing, Nurse Practitioner
  • Experience as Lead Clinical Document Improvement Specialist responsible for mentoring, coaching other Clinical Documentation Improvement Specialists
  • Possess one of the following Coding Professional Certifications: CPC, CCS-P, CCS

Additional Information

Nuance offers a compelling and rewarding work environment. We offer market competitive salaries, bonus, equity, benefits, meaningful growth and development opportunities and a casual yet technically challenging work environment. Join our dynamic, entrepreneurial team and become part of our continuing success.

Nuance Communication Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, age, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation and other legally protected characteristics. Senior Demand Generation Manager at BetterUp

Remote | International

Anywhere

BetterUp is seeking an experienced Senior Demand Generation Manager to drive BetterUp’s integrated campaigns for our marketing team. You will think conceptually and strategically to use campaigns to drive demand, working cross-functionally to spread BetterUp’s mission to enable professionals everywhere to live their lives with better clarity, purpose, and passion.

Your will help guide the campaign strategy, managing key aspects of marketing qualified lead development, campaigns, ABM (Account Based Marketing) initiatives, and a broad multi-channel and interdepartmental approach. You will aid in driving strategic development and execution of BetterUps integrated marketing “Strike” campaigns, collaborating with marketing and any other key stakeholders (Business Development Reps and Sales) to deliver a world-class experience that produces high-quality pipeline. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where you may find yourself with a number of balls in the air, and yet you have the ability to manage these tasks on time and on budget, consistently delivering an excellent outcome.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Aid in the development and execution of Strikes (Integrated Campaigns) by extending and leveraging every aspect of the demand channel from organic/paid search, content syndication, direct mail, webinars, regional events, trade shows, corporate events, e-mail marketing, advertising, and nurture.
  • Collaborate closely with product marketing to create campaign messaging, funnel narratives and content aligned with BetterUp’s brand, positioning, and messaging.
  • Enable the development of effective ABM (Account Based Marketing) programs based on account segmentation strategies and collaboration with field marketing.
  • Help manage the development of demand generation programs that generate a consistent flow of marketing qualified leads and first meetings leveraging a variety of channels.
  • Work in collaboration with Marketing Ops to track metrics and reporting against planned goals including, but not limited to: campaigns, programs, pipeline, funnel health, and data hygiene.
  • Develop and manage marketing program budgets to deliver effective ROI.
  • Collaborate closely with Communications, Product Marketing, Senior Behavior Scientist, and BetterUp Labs, to create industry-leading content aligned with BetterUp’s brand, positioning, and messaging.
  • Collaborate closely with the field to educate, inspire, support, and promote the integrated campaigns and demand programs to ensure tight alignment and incorporation into prospecting and sales cycles.

Experience and Skills:

  • 5-8+ years of experience in demand generation and marketing mix strategies.
  • Demonstrable experience in conducting successful ABM campaigns and marketing lead generation programs.
  • A proven track record in developing relationships and driving campaigns through media, third party publishers and networks.
  • A creative mind and an innovative approach to building programs and initiatives.
  • A collaborative approach to working across complex organizations and building relationships.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills across all levels, from individual contributors to executive staff.
  • An ability to prioritize across multiple projects and multi-task across a number of initiatives.

Benefits
We provide amazing benefits, but if you ask the team, they’ll tell you that the greatest benefit we offer employees is an incredibly meaningful mission and transformative work.

  • Full coverage medical, dental and vision insurance
  • Unlimited use, at your own discretion, vacation policy
  • 14 paid annual holidays
  • 5 “Volunteer Days” to give back
  • Professional development through BetterUp coaching for you and a significant other
  • 401(k) self contribution
  • A competitive compensation plan with opportunity for advancement
