items.content:
Sales & Marketing Manager


Aeolidia is growing and we’re looking for a Sales & Marketing Manager to join our team! You might be the perfect fit for this full-time, remote position if you are an ambitious and highly-skilled sales and marketing manager, who combines creativity with strategy to develop innovative strategies and campaigns to shape the future of our company.


Aeolidia is a “one stop shop” design agency that develops brands and creates story-centered ecommerce websites for designers, artisans, and curators that have made it past the startup phase.  We pair our custom strategic Shopify websites with analytical insights to continually optimize clients’ sites, resulting in significant growth to their online retail sales.


Our employees are directly responsible for empowering awesome business owners to succeed, and are challenged with meaningful work that improves their particular skills. If this all sounds excellent to you, please keep reading to see if we might be a match to work together!


A Bit About Us


Aeolidia is a graphic design and web development agency that has been working with designer and artisan businesses since 2004. We’re the preeminent design team in our creative niche, and we dig deep into strategy based on information we get from each client’s website analytics while also truly understanding the branding part of it. We deliver a gorgeous AND powerful site every time.


A designer or artist’s story should be compelling to customers. We focus on storytelling for brands. This is about each business’s “why” and what makes them unique and irreplaceable to their perfect customers. Since we do business naming, brand vision and voice, brand graphic identity, copywriting, and photography in-house, we have the capability to craft a cohesive story without losing anything along the way.


We are a remote team of overachievers, united in our common goal of taking creative businesses to the next level by paving the way toward substantial increases to online sales.


Now Let’s Talk About You


As the Sales & Marketing Manager, you’re a critical part of the leadership team. You enjoy leading people, as well as managing the day-to-day sales and marketing operations of a thriving and ever-changing business. You’re creative, charismatic, knowledgeable, and exceptionally well-versed in the latest sales and marketing techniques, as well as tried-and-true practices. You will increase productivity, inspire and motivate junior employees, and optimize our company’s market share.


Here are just a few ways we see you being successful in the Sales & Marketing Manager role with Aeolidia:


You’re a Diligent Achiever


You work smartly to deliver a truly top notch experience to your clients. You seek unique solutions, meet each deadline, and just plain get things done. You are a reliable go-getter.


Capable, persistent, and resourceful, you never despair when you hit a roadblock or need to figure out something new. You give it a try, do the research, try try again, ask for help, test it out, succeed, then consider it a learning experience and a new tool in your kit.


You’re a Curious Learner


You know it would be easy to keep doing what has worked in the past, but you also know that technology changes quickly, each business is different, and what works in one case won’t be the best solution in others.


You stay abreast of advancements in design, technology, and each specialty area in your role. You value being at the top of your game, even as things change. You have big ideas, and you’re eager to figure out how to do them.


You’re a Humble Expert


It’s important that each member of our team approaches the client relationship from the mindset of a “doctor”—using their years of expertise and insight to prescribe the right solution. This is in sharp contrast to the “waiter” mentality of taking orders and doing what is asked of us.


You remember that each client knows their business better than you do, and that you have a lot to learn from them. You strike the balance by being authoritative but cooperative and open-minded. You are experienced and your role is to help guide your client down the path to their goal.


You are highly collaborative and function well within a team. You feel comfortable asking for help and being open about what you don’t yet know. And, in turn, eagerly show up and share the special knowledge you do have without being arrogant about it. You also facilitate a team environment where each member feels the same.


You’re a Positive Ally


You anticipate your clients’ needs and concerns, and take an active role in making them feel comfortable with their brand, their technology, and their next steps.


When you see a problem you can solve or help with, you leap to action to make progress toward a solution. You take as much responsibility for client dissatisfaction as you can, knowing that you’re the one guiding the relationship and setting expectations.


You find solutions that are more than just acceptable, but something the client is happy with, and that keeps your relationship with them on a good track.


You’re a Creative Supporter


Your work is meaningful to you. Making a website and getting money is not the satisfying part. You’re in this to watch your clients exceed their goals and feel proud to have contributed.


You care about and believe in your clients’ businesses. You have a personal connection that makes the journeys of designer and artisan businesses meaningful to you.


You understand, you relate to, you value and respect each client and their business. With every step on their project, you are aiming to propel your client to where they want to be next.


A Day in the Life


Now that we’ve covered what it’s like to work with Aeolidia, let’s chat about what you would be doing on an average day. The full-time Sales & Marketing Manager will work approximately 40 hours per week designing, implementing, and improving sales and marketing strategies. You will be responsible for identifying and targeting new markets, generating new leads, managing the sales and marketing processes, tracking and assessing the effectiveness of each sales and marketing strategy, providing guidance for your team, and removing obstacles and barriers from their path so they can effectively execute the plan.


As the Sales & Marketing Manager, you will work closely with the CEO/Founder and Director of Operations to ensure the sales and marketing strategies are aligned with the company vision and goals. You will be responsible for translating and communicating the vision and goals to everyone on your team to ensure they understand what is expected of them in their individual roles. You will help drive results by keeping your team focused on the big picture vision and goals, developing team unity, and prioritizing projects so the team can follow through and execute them on schedule. You thrive in the post-project followup (gathering satisfaction surveys, testimonials, case studies, etc.) and understand its role in a successful sales process to attract new clients.


Every position with Aeolidia is a remote one, meaning you get to work from wherever you are! This also means that you will be leading a remote team. There are no set schedules or hours. Flexible schedules that fit around your life are what we do best. However, of course we do expect all of our team members to meet their goals and project expectations, so we’ll have weekly meetings to check in on progress, celebrate successes and help clear roadblocks that have a tendency to pop up from time to time. In addition to meetings with your supervisor, you’ll also be leading these meetings with your own direct reports, as well as following up on what they have learned from their team members. We want to ensure you (and every team member at Aeolidia) have every chance to be successful in this role and we’re committed to doing our part to make sure you are.


You’re a Great Fit For Our Team If:

  • You can commit to working 40 hours per week.
  • You have a reliable internet connection which allows you to work from anywhere.
  • You work closely with the CEO/Founder and Director of Operations to help bring the goals of the company to life through the sales and marketing processes.
  • You’re an experienced and confident leader, comfortable with overseeing multiple team members, setting expectations, discussing project goals and outcomes, delegating and handling difficult conversations in a timely manner when they’re needed, all while keeping the company vision in the forefront.
  • You’re not someone who settles for the status quo. You continuously look for ways to improve and streamline the company’s sales and marketing processes.
  • You’re experienced with the end-to-end sales process, including brand and product positioning, generating more leads through prospecting and outreach, creating proposals using value pricing methods, following up, and tracking and improving conversion rates.
  • You enjoy traveling to events as a representative of the brand to help broaden the company’s presence, including trade shows, conferences, etc.
  • You understand the importance of proper project scheduling and pricing to maximize our team’s efforts and generate a higher ROI per project.
  • You stay up-to-date on the latest trends in sales and marketing to stay top of mind with customers and get in front of new audiences.
  • You regularly track and analyze company stats to know what marketing activities are a strategic use of time and which we should eliminate.
  • You maintain and regularly add to our content marketing strategy, which includes blogging, email marketing, and social media use to stay in front of our audience.
  • You thrive in the post-project followup, including: satisfaction surveys, testimonials, review of external sites, permission to use client work in our portfolio and conducting case study interviews for our blog.
  • You embrace your position as the spokesperson of the brand. You enjoy communicating with our audience through our website, regular blogging, email marketing, and social media, as well as engaging with our community in our Facebook group, by email, and in person.
  • You love seeking out new opportunities to reach out to others within our industry and niche to partner, collaborate, and/or provide value to their communities.
  • You excel at planning and executing events that help the company showcase our skills and services to a broader audience.
  • You consistently demonstrate a passion for values alignment, focus, simplicity, and clarity across the organization

Bonus Points:

  • You’ve been in a sales and/or marketing role for at least five (5) years.
  • You have one (1) to two (2) years of management experience.
  • You hold a bachelor’s degree or higher in business or marketing.
  • You’ve worked with and supported creative, small businesses.

Fun Perks to Look Forward To:


As part of the Aeolidia team, here are some benefits we will offer you:

  • Flexible work schedule
  • Remote work position
  • 3 weeks of paid vacation, more or less (we’re pretty laid back when it comes to taking time off)
  • Major holidays are paid time off
  • Freedom to take a reasonable number of paid personal days off – we’re family friendly
  • Our virtual office is closed for two weeks during the winter holiday season
  • Participation in a SIMPLE IRA plan with 3% annual company matching
  • Reimbursement for phone and internet plans (based on position)
  • Opportunity to participate in the company’s profit sharing program upon eligibility
  • Culture flexibility and freedom in decision making, problem solving, autonomous work environment, and ownership of your position and responsibilities

Salary for this role will be based upon your experience and education.


Aeolidia is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity of backgrounds, beliefs, and experiences to be critical to our success and are passionate about creating a welcoming, supportive, and collaborative environment for all employees. All are encouraged to apply as we continue to grow a smart, hard-working, and diverse team who love working together to build something that matters.


How to Apply

  • Apply by August 30, 2019. This is your first test. If you can’t meet this deadline, we probably aren’t a great match.
  • Attach a PDF of your cover letter. In your cover letter:
    • Introduce yourself and explain why this position is of interest to you and why you would be a great fit.

Mindojo is developing a self-evolving, adaptive AI platform for personalized education. Our products are already being successfully used to deliver market-leading courses by some of the world’s top media brands such as Bloomberg LP and The Economist. We’re building a team of experts passionate about making a world-changing impact through our upcoming line of products aimed to disrupt higher-education.

In the Marketing Manager role you will create and execute the marketing strategies for our many upcoming products (online courses), optimize the different channels, lead new initiatives to drive the company’s goals, all while upholding the reputation of the company and its partner brands.

We have a brilliant team of content experts who create unique non-linear learning content, and we’re on the way to disrupting the global education market. On our platform, students are constantly engaged in personalized dialogue with our AI private tutor, far surpassing the efficacy of existing resources (textbooks, video or classroom lectures, and various e-learning products).

We offer a full-time contract for a remote Marketing Manager. You can work from wherever you wish and the work schedule is very flexible.

Our culture
We believe in minimum bureaucracy and maximum creative freedom. Our team members enjoy plenty of autonomy and are measured mostly by their actual deliverables. We work hard (who’s not familiar with healthy deadlines?) but are happy knowing that our efforts will help improve the lives of many and help the global economy at large. We love people who can approach problems from different angles and who are comfortable asking tough questions and proposing innovative solutions. We aren’t afraid to switch to new technologies as soon as it makes sense, and as a consequence, much of our stack is always at the cutting edge. We’re continuously looking for ways to improve our processes, and everyone’s suggestions are heard and considered on their merit, not based on seniority.

We’d like to hear from a candidate who has:

  • 5-10 years of marketing experience with at least 3 years of experience formulating marketing strategies for technology-based product companies or start-ups.
  • Experience creating and executing high-impact multi-channel marketing campaigns across digital and offline channels (advertising, web, social, email, in-product, etc.)

  • A test-and-learn mindset, with the DNA of rapid experimentation.
  • Experience working with analytics to ensure results-driven marketing.
  • Ability to prioritize and work independently on several tasks simultaneously.
  • Strong work ethic and ability to adapt quickly.
  • Excellent communication and people skills.
  • Fluent English, oral and written, is a must.

Bonus points for:

  • Education/EdTech Experience.
  • Master’s degree in Marketing, or similar.

What you will be doing:

  • Lead the marketing strategy, planning, execution, and optimization across existing and new products.
  • Closely work with product managers and designers to optimize conversion and ongoing use of our apps.
  • Launch and test new initiatives.
  • Analyze results and convey them to management.
  • Manage budget, allocation to different marketing channels, and ROI.

What we offer:

  • Competitive compensation.
  • Meaningful stock option plan.
  • Extremely talented and friendly colleagues.
  • Ability to work from home/anywhere in the world.
  • Company-sponsored international retreats and educational programs.

How to apply: Please email a cover letter and CV. Applications without a cover letter will not be accepted.


 


School Space - Why
Like it or not, funding plays a critical role in a schools ability to deliver a great education, and we are unfortunately facing a funding cut crisis in the UK, the scale of which hasn’t been seen since WWII. This is the first problem we’re trying to solve.
Secondly, a recent study (conducted by the Eden project) identified that disconnected communities cost the UK economy over £32 billion/year. Extensive research has concluded that people feel happier, safer and more content when they live in connected communities and know their neighbours. Across the UK, connected communities are simply not happening.
This is where School Space comes in.


School Space - How
Schools have lots of spaces that sit empty on evenings, weekends, and holidays.
We work with schools across the South East to help them let their spaces to community groups, which not only increases school income, it also makes affordable spaces available to the locals which in turn helps to build a thriving school at the center of a thriving community.


School Space - Team
Founders James and Jemma have been working on this problem for 7 years, and recent success includes investment raises, 29 partner schools, over half a million generated for them. We’ve been on the Techstars 2018 Cohort, been nominated for Social Enterprise UK’s Social Enterprise of the Year, and picked up a few awards and amazing networks along the way. Our team are committed to the n th degree and full of the belief that social business is the model of the future. We have endless determination to see School Space grow fast and well, scaling our impact across the UK and beyond. In the mix we have Oxbridge graduates, marathon runners, a pilot, industry veterans, an Olympic torch bearer and a man who once ran a marathon with no training/trainers for an onion bhaji.


Community Manager
The Role - Why
We have an incredible local team that need training, inspiring and leading. You
will be responsible for leading a group of up to 80 Community Connectors (part
time staff who work based at our schools in the evenings and weekends). You will
have administrative support but lead the direction and engagement strategy to
ensure our team are empowered with the tools to do their job, with a focus on
retention.



The Role - How
Key responsibilities include:



  • Line Management - whilst most of our remote team work between 5-15 hours per week, they need a point of contact, and you must master supporting them individually whilst drawing on others in your team to balance this responsibility

  • Developing and Leading an engagement strategy - our Community Connectors (CCs) already engage via weekly videos from the co-founders and use slack to communicate, but we want you to revamp their ‘journey’ as a School Space team member, developing the touchpoints they should have to feel supported throughout their lifetime with us

  • Developing a training programme - you would be responsible for starting the ‘School Space Academy’, which will involve training new starters and providing refreshers for existing staff members.


What we want from you:



  • Comfort in working evenings and weekends, as training will have to be done in these hours (expectation; minimum one weekend a month, taken in lieu)

  • Experience in leading communities, or managing large groups of people to success.

  • A track record of developing a strategy yourself and seeing it through

  • Empathy and excellent people skills - an ability to manage but also inspire via ‘low touch’ methods including innovative techniques

  • The ability to self-start and self manage, to bring your own ideas to the table and manage them from start to finish

  • Excellent time management and prioritisation skills

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, comfortable with using basic tech tools such as slack

  • The ability and desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment with peers who challenge you to constantly improve

  • An eagerness to take on more responsibility, and you thrive on change - we are a start up and that means things are fast moving.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.content:
Enthusiastic Product Designer

Memberful is reliable membership software for independent publishers, educators, and creators. We recently joined Patreon, and we're excited to continue expanding our team.

What we're looking for

It's fun and rewarding to work with people who are enthusiastic and get stuff done. At Memberful, we're a self managed team. We don't require heavy direction or daily check-ins. This means you'll come up with your own goals and execute them. You'll discover, plan, and see things through from start to finish. This job is for you if:

  • You’re enthusiastic about life and work on a daily basis.
  • You embrace responsibility and new challenges.
  • You care deeply about form and function.
  • You look for opportunities to improve process.
  • You thrive on organization and planning.
  • You do what it takes to get things done on time.
  • You have experience working remotely and enjoy it.
  • You recognize it's about building a great product, and therefore embrace discussion and criticism of ideas.
  • You don't like working with complainers or blamers.
  • You don't claim to be an expert at everything, but you show a strong desire to learn new things and continually get better.
  • You don’t just report the problem, you present a plan for fixing it.

You should be hungry and excited to take on real responsibility and work hard on useful software with real paying customers.

What you’ll work on

We're a very small team, so you'll have a unique opportunity to make a big impact. You'll be working on a product used by well over hundred thousand people, and we'll be counting on you to challenge us and lead Memberful in exciting new directions. You'll bring creativity, fresh perspective, and a skeptical but open mind to our process.

You'll work on a variety of different things at Memberful, including our website, product strategy, and product marketing, but you'll mostly be working with one or two talented engineers to plan, design, and build exciting new features for Memberful customers. You'll also work with our customers directly to help understand the problems we're trying to solve.

Skills, Salary, & Benefits

You should have visual taste, design talent, and excellent writing skills. You know copywriting is at the core of great design. You should also write well-structured HTML/CSS, as you'll be responsible for designing and building the frontend of our product. Rails experience is a bonus, but definitely not required.

  • Competitive salary based on experience.
  • Work remotely from anywhere in the world.
  • Flexible vacation. Take it when you need it.
  • Health insurance if you're in the United States.

How to apply

To apply, send an email to jobs @ memberful.com. Please include [DESIGNER] in the subject line and include some examples of your recent work. If we think you're a good fit, we'll reply with next steps.

We strongly favor candidates who put extra effort into their cover letter and application. Let us know why you want this job, not just any job.

Applications close: 5pm on 6th September 2019
Interview dates: 11th and 12th September 2019
Start date: Immediate
Location: London
Hours: 9:30am - 6pm Monday - Friday, plus at least one day of weekend work per month, with time taken in lieu
Salary: £35,000 - £40,000 p/a
Contract Type: Full time, flexible and remote working possible (for the right
candidate)
How to apply: Please email a cover letter and CV. Applications without a cover letter will not be accepted.


 


School Space - Why
Like it or not, funding plays a critical role in a schools ability to deliver a great education, and we are unfortunately facing a funding cut crisis in the UK, the scale of which hasn’t been seen since WWII. This is the first problem we’re trying to solve.
Secondly, a recent study (conducted by the Eden project) identified that disconnected communities cost the UK economy over £32 billion/year. Extensive research has concluded that people feel happier, safer and more content when they live in connected communities and know their neighbours. Across the UK, connected communities are simply not happening.
This is where School Space comes in.


School Space - How
Schools have lots of spaces that sit empty on evenings, weekends, and holidays.
We work with schools across the South East to help them let their spaces to community groups, which not only increases school income, it also makes affordable spaces available to the locals which in turn helps to build a thriving school at the center of a thriving community.


School Space - Team
Founders James and Jemma have been working on this problem for 7 years, and recent success includes investment raises, 29 partner schools, over half a million generated for them. We’ve been on the Techstars 2018 Cohort, been nominated for Social Enterprise UK’s Social Enterprise of the Year, and picked up a few awards and amazing networks along the way. Our team are committed to the n th degree and full of the belief that social business is the model of the future. We have endless determination to see School Space grow fast and well, scaling our impact across the UK and beyond. In the mix we have Oxbridge graduates, marathon runners, a pilot, industry veterans, an Olympic torch bearer and a man who once ran a marathon with no training/trainers for an onion bhaji.


Community Manager
The Role - Why
We have an incredible local team that need training, inspiring and leading. You
will be responsible for leading a group of up to 80 Community Connectors (part
time staff who work based at our schools in the evenings and weekends). You will
have administrative support but lead the direction and engagement strategy to
ensure our team are empowered with the tools to do their job, with a focus on
retention.



The Role - How
Key responsibilities include:



  • Line Management - whilst most of our remote team work between 5-15 hours per week, they need a point of contact, and you must master supporting them individually whilst drawing on others in your team to balance this responsibility

  • Developing and Leading an engagement strategy - our Community Connectors (CCs) already engage via weekly videos from the co-founders and use slack to communicate, but we want you to revamp their ‘journey’ as a School Space team member, developing the touchpoints they should have to feel supported throughout their lifetime with us

  • Developing a training programme - you would be responsible for starting the ‘School Space Academy’, which will involve training new starters and providing refreshers for existing staff members.


What we want from you:



  • Comfort in working evenings and weekends, as training will have to be done in these hours (expectation; minimum one weekend a month, taken in lieu)

  • Experience in leading communities, or managing large groups of people to success.

  • A track record of developing a strategy yourself and seeing it through

  • Empathy and excellent people skills - an ability to manage but also inspire via ‘low touch’ methods including innovative techniques

  • The ability to self-start and self manage, to bring your own ideas to the table and manage them from start to finish

  • Excellent time management and prioritisation skills

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, comfortable with using basic tech tools such as slack

  • The ability and desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment with peers who challenge you to constantly improve

  • An eagerness to take on more responsibility, and you thrive on change - we are a start up and that means things are fast moving.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Start date: Immediate start or 1st October 2019

Contract Type: Full time, flexible and remote working possible (for the right
candidate)
How to apply: Please email a cover letter and CV. Applications without a cover letter will not be accepted.


 


About us
School Space works with schools to rent out their facilities to the community. The
income generated is used by the schools to improve the educational experience
and facilities for their students, in addition to building stronger connections with
the surrounding community. Having recently raised significant investment we are
entering a period of rapid growth which will see us head towards our goal of giving
£7m in income back to our schools by 2020.


Our culture
We strongly believe that our people are at the heart of our success. From weekly
update videos from the founders, to regular training days, daily stand-ups, socials
and unexpected ‘magic moments’. Our core values are Transparency, Positivity,
Initiative, Community, Drive/Passion and Learning. We are driven to improve and
develop every team member at School Space and actively encourage all team
members to proactively contribute to our culture.



Our impact
In the last 12 months, we’ve generated over half a million pounds for our partner
schools. That equates to 200,000+ free school meals, 40 additional teaching
assistants, 85,000 footballs but importantly, a brighter future for those schools.


Our story
In 2010, our founders, James and Jemma, became part of Wheatley Park School’s Head Boy and Girl Team. In their final year, the school was put into special measures’ by Ofsted. It became the pair’s mission to show that their school was about more than this ‘failing’, and they struck on the idea of
renting out Wheatley Park’s facilities to generate income and open their doors to the local community.


School Partnership Manager
Why does this job exist?
Our London operation covers 20 schools (and growing), 40+ Community
Connectors (the amazing people who open and close our schools) and thousands
of events annually. The School Partnership Manager manages the relationship
between School Space and our schools, allowing us to fulfil our mission of
generating them income and connecting them with their community.



What kinds of things will you be accountable for?
Account Management



  • Work closely with each of your School accounts to ensure that they are
    achieving success from the School Space/School Partnership

  • Develop relationships within each of our Partner Schools to communicate
    our successes, ensuring the whole School staff are ‘on side’ and understand
    the benefits of lettings

  • Take responsibility for resigning contracts and School Partnership
    Agreements

  • Conduct school performance reviews/meetings, and undertake actions as
    appropriate

  • Financials and Reporting

  • Provide regular reports of expected results, variances and comparisons to be
    fed back to management team - including but not limited to financials

  • Understand how your schools fit into our income targets and help remove
    obstacles to our Business Development team generating them more
    income


Business Development



  • Driving high level community relationships around each school zone -
    including relationship building with community leaders

  • Constantly look for new schools who might want to partner with us

  • Focus on developing processes to improve account management wherever
    you see an opportunity to do so


Operations



  • Gather information on each school site so that our customers and internal
    team have the tools to run bookings successfully 

  • Communicate with our customer operations team to locate venue details
    and ensure the site is used in an appropriate manner
    How will you know it’s going brilliantly?

  • You are achieving a high satisfaction score with all of your School accounts
    (measured fortnightly)

  • The users of our venues are scoring our service/schools over 8 on our
    feedback reports and any issues are tackled head on with swift resolution
    and constant customer communication

  • School revenues are on the up and contracts get re-signed at renewal point
    What will help you succeed in this role?

  • Confidence to account manage, ask the right questions, and have difficult
    conversations with a range of personalities, in the pursuit of providing great
    ‘service’ to our schools

  • An ability to quickly problem solve and proactively address any worries and
    concerns from your School accounts

  • Great communication skills and ability to manage (and empathise with)
    different personalities and identify their motivations

  • Attention to detail, handling all day-to-day tasks with diligence and pride

  • A passion for helping Schools/education sector

  • Confidence to cope with the fast-paced, and changing nature of a growing
    company

  • Experience working remotely, individually, and as part of a team

  • An ability to see the positives of working in an evolving business with new
    systems and process being brought in on a regular basis


Why should you work for us?
If the above wasn’t enough(!), School Space is a family that cares about its impact.
We sleep well at night knowing that we are contributing to a growing company, as
well as providing schools with opportunities to increase their budgets and do good
for their community.
Aside from this, being a small team, the exposure to all elements of business
equips our team with the ability to turn their hand to many future endeavours!


 


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Thinkful

Data Analytics Curriculum Writer

Job Description Thinkful is launching a new immersive data analytics program which aims to be the best in-class remote, full-time data science program offered today. As part of this effort, we're looking for a  data analytics subject matter expert to join us in executing on our content roadmap for this exciting new program. You will be creating the backbone of a new program that propels people from into an impactful career as Data Analysts. You'll produce written content, lesson plans including instructor notes and student activity descriptions, presentation decks, code assets, and written content, all to support our students as they learn the core skills of data science. Your work product will be extremely impactful, as it forms the core asset around which the daily experience of our students will revolve.  Responsibilities * Consistently deliver content that meets spec and is on time to support our program launch roadmap. * Create daily lesson plans consisting of  * Presentation decks that instructors use to lecture students on a given learning objective. * Instructor notes that instructors use alongside  * Activity descriptions — these are notes describing tasks students complete together in order to advance the learning objective in a given lecture. * Creates curriculum checkpoint content on specific learning objectives. In addition to the in-class experience, our students also spend time reading and completing tasks for a written curriculum hosted on the Thinkful platform.  * Creates code assets to support lesson plans, student activities, and written curriculum content. * Iterates on deliverables based on user feedback Requirements * 3+ years of hands-on experience as a business analyst, data analyst, research analyst, product analyst, or similar functional role within an organization  * Know the difference between using data to tell stories vs. telling stories about data, and intuitively understand that it is the former that drives business value * Comfortable collecting, blending, munging, cleaning, and analyzing disparate data sources using tools like Excel, Tableau, and Python * Collaborative.You enjoy partnering with people and have excellent project management skills and follow through * Excellent writing skills. You've got a gift for writing about complicated concepts in a beginner-friendly way. You can produce high-quality prose as well as high-quality presentations. Compensation and Benefit * Contract position with a collaborative team * Ability to work remotely with flexible hours  * Access to all available course curriculum for personal use * Membership to a global community of over 500 Software Engineers, Developers, and Data Scientists who, like you, want to keep their skills sharp and help learners break into the industry

items.title: Public Relations and Outreach Coordinator
items.content:
Public Relations and Outreach Coordinator at Single Grain

Remote

REMOTE · United States · Marketing

DESCRIPTION

About Us

Single Grain is a small, but mighty, digital marketing agency in downtown LA. We specialize in PPC, Paid Social, SEO, and Content Marketing working with clients such as Intuit, Uber, and Amazon. Our founder and thought leader, Eric Siu, has led Single Grain to where it is now and is continuing to grow its audiences through a variety of channels.

Eric hosts two podcasts – Marketing School (1M downloads/mo) and Growth Everywhere (100k downloads/mo). Growth Everywhere posts weekly interviews of world-class entrepreneurs and C-level executives and pulls out actionable insights to help you grow personally and professionally. Marketing School brings you 10 minutes of marketing advice and strategies every single day. We speak at conferences as well as host our own, we run a blog with over 200,000 visitors/mo and have a YouTube channel with 22,000+ subscribers. We even have our own SaaS tool and educational products.

All of this is to fulfill our mission to create meaningful predictable growth for business-owners and companies from Series A start-ups to tech giants and enterprises.

About You

We are looking for a humble, hungry and smart PR and Outreach Coordinator to join our growing Content team. You will be a great fit if

  • You are tech-savvy, self-starting, resourceful, entrepreneurial, endlessly curious, and highly ambitious
  • You have effective time management and organization skills, strong communication and interpersonal skills, a positive attitude and a growth mindset
  • You meet deadlines, pay attention to details, think on your feet, ask for help when you need it, and consistently demonstrate respect for others

When you apply, please include the words “PR is Cool” in your cover letter. Any applicants that do not include this phrase will not be considered.

About the Role

The ideal Public Relations and Guest Outreach Coordinator will leverage their own insights and industry knowledge to uplift Single Grain and its properties to new heights through strategic partnerships and collaborations with other brands, publications, and influencers. This creative thinker will need to be a people-person and be able to communicate professionally, both written and verbal. You will report to the Single Grain Founder as well as the Head of Content. This position is a remote contractor role.

  • Research, qualify, and outreach to influencers/bloggers, publications, and Single Grain’s business audiences for collaborations
  • Proactively pitch new engagement ideas and opportunities for partnerships, sponsorships, and advertising to reach new customers and audiences, ensuring content is compelling and aligns with Single Grain’s voice and objectives
  • Assist with product launches and promotions while maintaining editorial and events calendar for the Marketing team
  • Compose press pitches, media alerts, and social media copy as well as assist in writing articles for newsletters, blogs, magazines, and websites
  • Analyze, measure, and report on influencer activity during and after campaigns to evaluate, address learning, and optimize future initiatives
  • Continuously monitor the latest trends and changes in the digital publication world to ensure we are always ahead of the curve in our knowledge and capabilities

REQUIREMENTS

  • 3+ years in PR/Communications/Marketing
  • Demonstrated interest in digital marketing industry, entrepreneurship, and startups
  • Impeccable written and communication skills including rapport building and interacting with team members at all management levels
  • Excellent time and project management skills with the ability to work remotely and independently
  • Extremely detailed, organized, reliable, trustworthy, and takes initiative with a positive attitude
  • Ability to use G-Suite and PowerPoint
  • Please include the words “PR is Cool” in your cover letter (or else your application will not be considered)

BENEFITS

  • Remote position
  • Growth-oriented culture that values open communication and transparency
  • Already working with a large audience, thriving email list, and prominent influencers and entrepreneurs in the industry
  • Close-knit hard-working team members!

items.title: Product Owner
items.content:
Product Owner at AirDev

Remote | Freelance

Remote / San Francisco, California | Contract / Full-time

Thanks for your interest in this position – we’re excited to build great software together! Below is some basic info about us and the role, so you know what you’re getting into.

About AirDev

We founded AirDev to change how custom software is made. Our goals are to dramatically lower the technical and financial barriers to making technical products and to enable people without traditional coding skills to make a good living building those products.

Co-founders Andrew and Vlad were some of the original Bubble users in 2013, and were amazed at the web platforms they could build without a technical background. They started AirDev in 2015 as the first Bubble agency, building apps for clients of all shapes and sizes.

We’ve grown significantly since and now help hundreds of clients all over the globe, from one-person startups to large enterprises, build high-quality software in a matter of weeks.

About the role and its responsibilities

Product Owners act as the Head of Product/CTO for our clients, helping them think through their idea and turn it into concrete requirements that our developers and designers can execute on. Their primary task is to create a product that’s as good as possible while ensuring that it’s scoped to meet the client’s timeline and budget. Their specific responsibilities include:

  • Discuss the project with the client and determine what functionality is needed
  • Help the client think through their different options, corner cases, and simplest ways to build something
  • Research answers to technical questions that involve API integrations or complex workflows
  • Put together detailed specifications and wireframes based on the project requirements as well as our standards
  • Work with the development and design teams to execute on the project, providing feedback and guidance as needed
  • Help the client iterate on the product based on data, development best practices, and customer feedback

Qualities we look for

We value a mix of hard and soft skills, as well alignment to our core values in all of our people. Some specific qualities for this role include:

  • Excellent communication skills: Product Owners spend majority of their time interacting with clients, so they need to be very clear and structured in both verbal and written communication.
  • Product sense and commitment to simplicity: We see a large range of ideas and Product Owners should be able to quickly figure out the simplest way to turn those ideas into products, no matter what the industry or application.
  • Analytical skills: Designing software can be quite complex, so we look for strong conceptual and logical thinkers.
  • Software Experience: Ideal candidates will have 2+ years of experience building software, using Bubble or code (as either a developer or Product Manager).
  • Time management and being task-oriented: We work with lots of clients at once and always stick to our deadlines, which requires diligence and constantly moving the ball forward.
  • Enjoy intellectual & creative challenges: Finding the right technical solution to a human need is both an art and a science, and those who enjoy solving complex problems tend to be best suited for this role.

items.content:
Who are we?


Squirrel is a simple app that changes people’s lives for the better – by managing their money for them. Instead of getting paid into a bank account, Squirrel users get paid into Squirrel! The app then saves and budgets for them. Paying money into their bank account just before they need it – for bills, weekly spending, and when they finish saving up for something. It’s rare for ideas to be good for the world, unique, profitable, and be fun and challenging to work on – but Squirrel is all of these things!


The opportunity:


We are developing the next generation of Squirrel using Open Banking technologies. This is an amazing opportunity to help shape a product of the future from the outset. We've been awarded government funding through the Innovate UK Smart Grant initiative. You'll be leading a top tech team to design, develop and evolve a life-changing product.


What we’re looking for:


The ideal candidate will be a product manager with some experience handlng complex onboarding. We're looking for individuals who are grounded in user feedback and testing, with demonstrable experience in a relevant field. Fintech experience may be a bonus, but isn't essential.


Location: Ideally you’ll be London based, but we’re willing to consider remote workers in other parts of the UK (with occasional travel to the London office).

Our Vision._ **At Anthem, Inc.,** it s a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which we re creating greater access to care for our members, greater value for our customers, and greater health for our communities. Join us and together we will **drive the future of health care** .
This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve at one of America's leading health benefits companies and a Fortune Top 50 Company.
**Health Educator**
**Location:** Remote; Preferred locations: Denver, CO and Atlanta, GA.

Friday- 2:30-11:00 pm EST

Your knowledge of chronic health conditions and enthusiasm for health education and wellness is just what our members are seeking! At Anthem, emphasizing the importance of health and wellness among our members means healthy living as well for our employees. That's why we seek Health Education professionals who embody our commitment to living well, who share a
passion to influence others and advocate healthy living. The knowledge and information our health educators provide to our members positively impacts healthy life choices, provides a sense of well-being, helps prevent chronic and/or preventable conditions, and helps them to access the numerous resources available to them.
As we add Health Educator staff for our call center's Health and Wellness telephonic Coaching Programs, we look for individuals who share in our beliefs. In addition to a comprehensive benefits package, our educators enjoy every Sunday off plus paid holidays, and work from home.
As a **Health Educator** within a call center environment, you'll be focused on:
+ Making enrollment calls to members who are eligible for telephonic wellness programs.
+ Assessing health information for members with various coaching needs that may include chronic conditions, lifestyle management, weight management, and smoking cessation.
+ Setting up goals and providing coaching as well as telephonic follow up calls to members to continue to work on health goals.
+ Encourage members to get connected to resources that are available to them through their insurance, which could include participation in additional or different coaching programs.

+ Utilize motivational interviewing skills to provide health coaching for members with chronic conditions or other identified health needs.
+ Implementing and/or coordinating coaching care plans and discussing clinical health recommendations and preventative recommendations.

+ Prior call center or telephonic health education/clinical coaching experience a plus.
+ CHES certification an added plus.
+ Bi-lingual English/Spanish a plus.
This position is remote, must live within 50 miles of an Anthem office location. Preferred locations are Denver, CO or Atlanta, GA.

We Are Hiring
What if you found an opportunity where your skills were used to impact lives? We are looking for a Remote Transformational Consultant to propel Ascension into the future. If you enjoy creating something new, dreaming big, and have a passion for your expertise we encourage you to apply!
Why Join Ascension?
Ascension is a faith-based healthcare organization dedicated to transformation through innovation across the continuum of care. As one of the largest non-profit and Catholic health systems in the U.S., Ascension is committed to delivering compassionate, personalized care to all, with special attention to persons living in poverty and those most vulnerable. In FY2018, Ascension provided nearly $2 billion in care of persons living in poverty and other community benefit programs. Our Mission, Vision and Values guide everything we do at Ascension. They are foundational to our work to transform healthcare and express our priorities when providing care and services, particularly to those most in need.
Ascension includes approximately 156,000 associates and 34,000 aligned providers. Our national health system operates more than 2,600 sites of care - including 151 hospitals and more than 50 senior living facilities - in 21 states and the District of Columbia, while providing a variety of services including physician practice management, venture capital investing, investment management, biomedical engineering, facilities management, clinical care management, information services, risk management, and contracting through Ascension's own group purchasing organization.
In 2018, Ascension adopted our Advanced Strategic Direction, reaffirming our commitment to provide Healthcare That Works, Healthcare That Is Safe, and Healthcare That Leaves No One Behind, for Life, while embracing a Dual Transformation strategy with a new perspective that reflects the rapidly evolving healthcare environment. Our Advanced Strategic Direction provides the transformational strategic agenda that will enable Ascension to continue to deliver on our Mission commitment while ensuring a vibrant, sustainable health ministry for the future.

What You Will Do

items.content:
We Are Hiring
What if you found an opportunity where your skills were used to impact lives? We are looking for a Remote Transformational Consultant to propel Ascension into the future. If you enjoy creating something new, dreaming big, and have a passion for your expertise we encourage you to apply!
Why Join Ascension?
Ascension is a faith-based healthcare organization dedicated to transformation through innovation across the continuum of care. As one of the largest non-profit and Catholic health systems in the U.S., Ascension is committed to delivering compassionate, personalized care to all, with special attention to persons living in poverty and those most vulnerable. In FY2018, Ascension provided nearly $2 billion in care of persons living in poverty and other community benefit programs. Our Mission, Vision and Values guide everything we do at Ascension. They are foundational to our work to transform healthcare and express our priorities when providing care and services, particularly to those most in need.
Ascension includes approximately 156,000 associates and 34,000 aligned providers. Our national health system operates more than 2,600 sites of care - including 151 hospitals and more than 50 senior living facilities - in 21 states and the District of Columbia, while providing a variety of services including physician practice management, venture capital investing, investment management, biomedical engineering, facilities management, clinical care management, information services, risk management, and contracting through Ascension's own group purchasing organization.
In 2018, Ascension adopted our Advanced Strategic Direction, reaffirming our commitment to provide Healthcare That Works, Healthcare That Is Safe, and Healthcare That Leaves No One Behind, for Life, while embracing a Dual Transformation strategy with a new perspective that reflects the rapidly evolving healthcare environment. Our Advanced Strategic Direction provides the transformational strategic agenda that will enable Ascension to continue to deliver on our Mission commitment while ensuring a vibrant, sustainable health ministry for the future.

What You Will Do
As one of the early members of Ascension's newly-formed Transformation Management team, you will play a key role in establishing and growing this critical team with a System mandate to help transform our current core healthcare delivery system, while also developing new, transformational models for the future.
In this role, you will have the ability to make an immediate impact. You'll be in the thick of the action for Ascension as you work side-by-side with senior leaders who were hand-picked to lead our transformational journey.
You will serve as an important supporting role to the managers and directors helping coordinate cross-functional Design Teams tasked with defining transformation opportunities, designing prototypes, piloting solutions and implementing validated opportunities to reimagine the future of our industry consistent with our Advanced Strategic Direction and commitment to Dual Transformation.
This work will require you to be agile and proactive and utilize your analytical capabilities, presentation creation and delivery skills, and your ability to draw insights from large complex datasets.
As Transformation Consultant, you will report to Ascension Strategy Ministry Wide Function leadership, with exposure to senior level executives across the organization.
In this role, you will have the ability to work remotely with understood accessibility to a major airport for required travel.
Key Responsibilities
As a Transformation Consultant, your analytical, interpersonal, and critical thinking skills will be called upon from day one. You will be working alongside a team pursuing transformational opportunities that will shape and drive the overall strategy of Ascension consistent with our Advanced Strategic Direction and commitment to Dual Transformation.
  • Partner with and support Transformation Directors and Managers working in an agile manner to support Design Teams tasked with developing transformational opportunities
  • Aggregate, clean, consolidate and analyze complex data sets across multiple sources and develop key insights
  • Develop complex analytical models that provide insight and drive decision making
  • Identify and analyze research articles, secondary data, and industry reports
  • Create profiles of competitors / model companies, technologies, processes, etc.
  • Create required PowerPoint presentations
  • Support key deliverables for business case, Minimally Viable Product (MVP) or solution development
  • Assist with Design Team project management on an as needed basis
What You Will Need
Education:
  • Bachelor's degree required with a focus in business preferred; MBA preferred
Experience:
  • 1-3 years of experience in consulting, finance, or other similar experience where analytical and critical thinking skills are transferable.
  • Health care experience a plus.
  • A detail-oriented and highly-organized structured thinker who possess exceptional organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously in a fast-paced, complex work environment
  • Superior analytical skills with the ability to draw insights from complex datasets to inform decision making; proficient in financial modeling
  • A solid team player who is also an independent thinker
  • Must be deadline driven, organized and able to multi-task
  • Advanced Microsoft Office expertise (including PowerPoint, Word, and Excel)
  • Ability and willingness to travel 50+% to perform essential duties of the job

\"

items.content:
At WeGift, we’re on a mission to completely reinvent rewards by delivering open value, real time digital gifts, on demand. So far, we have built a unique and trusted product and work with many of the world’s leading gift card brands (like Amazon, Nike and Uber) and corporate partners (like Perkbox, Vouchercodes.co.uk and Coinbase). 


We recognise that building a world-class business requires a world-class effort, so we make sure that each team member is appreciated for the unique value and skills they bring. We are driven by the knowledge that there are still millions of businesses and consumers (in a £600 billion industry!) that we can help. If you’re looking for an environment that will inspire you to dream bigger, work harder and make a difference every day, you’re in the right place.


The Role


We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager to take the lead on the go-to-market strategy for our new products and features. In this role you will support our sales and marketing teams by articulating a compelling value proposition and company vision to our brands, buyers and customers. 


On a day-to-day basis you will: 



  • Create a go-to-market strategy and manage execution for our new products and features that is best-in-class and differentiates from the competition. 

  • Build core content that tells compelling stories about our products internally and externally.

  • Carry out market analysis and pricing analysis to drive strategic decisions that are in line with our growth plans.

  • Obtain insights into customers’ usage of current products and untapped opportunities through sales data and customer interviews .

  • Work with the Product,  Marketing and CS teams to deliver data sheets, marketing content and user guides.

  • Assist with product release planning, market feed-back, and product launches.



What we are looking for: 



  • Background in B2B sales or marketing, with 4+ years of specific Product Marketing experience

  • Ability to understand complex concepts and translate them into simple and appealing propositions 

  • Strong project management skills 

  • Experience in the SaaS tech sector 

  • A desire to work in a small collaborative team

  • Great organisational and time-management skills


Compensation 



  • £60k-70k


Benefits



  • Pension scheme (3% contribution)

  • Staff perks with WeGift brands - discounts of up to 12% on coffee, weekly groceries, holidays, the list is endless.

  • Flexible hours and work from home when needed - yes, yes everyone says this but we do.

  • A minimum of 25 days holiday + bank holidays (we’re not too descriptive about holidays so if you need more time off then just ask).

  • WeRecognise, where we shine the spotlight on exceptional employees every month who in turn get a £200 award in the eGift card of their choice.

  • Personal development budget - well actually there is no budget as we don’t believe in putting a cap on learning new things.

  • Generous maternity and paternity packages to make sure you get to spend time with your new bundle of joy.

  • Cycle to work scheme - save some £££ on buying a bike

  • Fully licensed as a tier 2 sponsor + relocation packages to help you get settled in.


Perks



  • Brand new WeWork office based in Monument, London.

  • A new laptop as standard - no one wants an old one when they need to be doing their best work + all the trimmings you need to get the perfect work setup.

  • Catered lunch once a week.

  • Monthly team socials (Escape Rooms, Karaoke - everyone gets a chance to choose what this looks like)


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.title: Email Marketing Manager
items.content:
Email Marketing Manager at Illuminate Education

Remote

Level: Experienced

Job Location: Irvine, CA – Irvine, CA

Position Type: Full Time

Education Level: Bachelor’s Degree

About Illuminate Education

Illuminate Education partners with K-12 educators to equip them with data to serve the whole child and reach new levels of student performance. Our solution brings together holistic data and collaborative tools and puts them in the hands of educators. Moment-by-moment, our users can visualize each student’s progress, determine the right instructional or intervention strategy, and take the next best action. Headquartered in Irvine, CA, Illuminate supports over 17 million students and 5200 schools and districts across all 50 states.

About the Opportunity

Position Overview
Do you have a knack for getting the right emails into the right inboxes at the right times? Do you live to see those open and clickthrough rates climb higher? We’re seeking an expert email marketer to join our team. You’ll be expected to develop and track email campaigns to ultimately increase our business’ email marketing success.

Location
Remote option for the right candidate.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage various email campaigns, including the template designs, calls-to-action, and content used in our email sends.
  • Segment lists based on behaviors like past email engagement and website interactions (content downloads, site page visits, etc.).
  • Measure results and optimize the lead nurturing workflows for these segments to convert leads into customers.
  • Work to minimize list decay and unsubscribes while increasing the productivity of our email sends.
  • Develop documentation and road maps for processes, A/B tests, and promotions that succeed through email.

Key Experience & Qualifications

  • BA/BS in English, journalism, marketing or a related discipline.
  • Past experience with email marketing, lead nurturing, marketing automation, and web analytics.
  • Excellent understanding of email marketing concepts and metrics such as sender score, deliverability, and sender reputation.
  • Proficiency in email marketing and marketing automation technology.
  • Highly analytical and able to derive meaning from data through A/B testing and email optimization.
  • Excellent writer and communicator (in both written and verbal form).
Apply for job

items.title: SEO Specialist (Remote)
items.content:
Pandable is a small but experienced SEO Agency with a remote team spanning across Europe and the US. We’re ambitious and fast-growing, and our clients range from exciting early stage startups to global companies, predominantly in finance and tech. We have big growth plans and are looking for a proactive SEO Specialist to help deliver outstanding results for client campaigns.


 


The role is both exciting and challenging: you will be given autonomy and responsibility, whilst being fully supported by the Managing Director and Performance Strategist.


 


Key Responsibilities



  • Work with leadership team to deliver successful campaigns for Pandable’s SEO clients

  • Communicate directly with clients where relevant

  • Develop in-depth, actionable strategic SEO roadmaps to achieve client goals

  • Carry out on-page and technical audits to identify issues and opportunities

  • Carry out content and backlink analysis to identify issues and opportunities

  • Work with clients and development teams to fix technical SEO issues

  • Perform ongoing keyword research and analysis

  • Research content and contribute to topic ideation and brainstorming sessions

  • Manage the production of and optimise on-site and off-site content

  • Develop and implement link building campaigns, including data research, content development, and outreach management

  • Report on performance against benchmarks and propose improvements

  • Work with leadership team to measure, monitor, and analyse SEO performance

  • Contribute to Pandable’s marketing activity when relevant

items.content:
Who are Opensignal?


Opensignal, a mobile analytics company, is the global standard for measuring real-world mobile network experience. Using billions of measurements collected 24/7 from tens of millions of smartphones, we analyze real-world mobile network experience at the largest scale and frequency in the wireless industry. We believe measuring how the network performs directly through users’ eyes is key to building better wireless networks. Our insights are used across the industry by mobile operators, telecoms regulators, equipment manufacturers and analysts. We have done business across six continents and have driven press headlines in 80 countries, in an industry impacting the lives of billions around the world.


Founded in 2010, Opensignal is a high-growth global company harnessing the power of mobile technologies and big data analytics to redefine how the mobile industry measures network performance. We’re part of the Global Telecoms ‘Power 100’, TechCity Future Fifty, and backed by an impressive portfolio of investors.


Having doubled our employee base to 60 at the beginning of 2019, we plan to grow beyond 80 by the end of 2019, to help drive our vision further. We're headquartered in London, UK, where you’ll find most of our employees, who we like to call 'Opensignalers', although we do have local teams based in the US who you will also work with. A truly international company, our ‘Opensignalers’ work across four continents, and represent over 25 nationalities.


Find out more by visiting our website


 


Purpose of the role


Opensignal collects vast amounts of unique data on the real-world experience of mobile networks globally. We are looking to add to our existing team of analysts to enhance our ability to communicate important data-based insights on the mobile telecom market, further cementing our position as the independent global standard for understanding the true state of mobile network experience. This is a US home-based role.


 


As an Insights Analyst, you will be responsible for:



  • Developing ideas on new ways to explore Opensignal’s data

  • Communicating your analysis in writing for publication externally

  • Placing Opensignal data and analytics into wider context with the developments in the mobile telecom industry e.g. the arrival of 5G, mobile operator strategies, auctions of wireless spectrum, mobile video streaming etc.

  • Adapting the analysis to the needs of different audiences and countries, for example across the US, South America, EMEA and Asia.

  • Collaborating closely with the wider Opensignal teams including Data Science, Engineering, Marketing and PR, to uncover and produce innovative insights

  • Creating compelling visualizations using Opensignal data


 


What we need from you:



  • The ideal person for the role will have experience working in the telecom industry or media outlet, for example: industry website; trade newsletter or magazine; industry analyst company; telecom consultancy; industry organization, telecom operator or vendor.


    • Knowledge of the US telecoms market would be a bonus!


  • Excellent and proven written communication skills - the ability to write clearly and concisely and communicate both quantitative and qualitative analysis in English is essential

  • Strong desire and passion for writing – we’d love it if this is something you really enjoy!

  • Excellent organisational skills – the ability to collaborate on multiple projects and pieces of insights in parallel is essential for the success in this role

  • Numerate, with the ability to use basic quantitative tools e.g. Excel

  • Ability to structure thinking using both qualitative and quantitative sources, adapting and showcasing this in an audience-centric manner


Ideal, but not essential:



  • Experience creating clear visualizations of data which succinctly communicate the insights from a piece of analysis.

  • Experience with visualization tools, e.g. Looker, R, Tableau, PowerPoint, plot.ly, etc


 


What will you get in return?



  • Competitive salary, stock options and on-target commission program to share our growth

  • Comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, matched-based 401(k) plan, attractive time off allowance and MacBook of your choice

  • Constant exposure to learning opportunities in your role and the ability to make an impact from day one, as well as a personal development budget for conferences, courses & training

  • Our 'Opensignalers' - an ambitious, focused and friendly team backed by some of Europe's top investors

  • Ability to work flexibly as well as regular all-company events, such as our bi-annual away days and quarterly company updates, where we bring our global ‘Opensignalers’ together at HQ.


To understand how we will be holding your information please take a look at our Recruitment Privacy Notice.

Growth Engineer - Remote

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer, Frontend Developer
Industry: Information Technology, Recruiting, Technology Staffing
Company size: 501–1k people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Toptal | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Warsaw +/- 4 hours

Technologies

frontend
backend
seo
sem

Job description

About Toptal

Toptal is a global network of top talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $100+ million in annual revenue and triple-digit growth, Toptal is the largest fully distributed workforce in the world.

We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun (see this video from The Huffington Post). We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.

Position Description

The Growth Hacking team has the goal of delivering results as quickly and accurately as possible to address the needs of the Growth Team at Toptal. We work on diverse projects related to Traffic, SEO, SEM, front-end development, back-end development, site performance, and anything else that needs immediate attention. We run an extremely agile planning process that is directly tied to the business needs of Toptal. We are looking for developers that enjoy a diversity of projects, rapid development and release, and being more connected to the business needs of the company.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere, with a preferred location in Europe. All communication and resumes must be submitted in English.

Responsibilities:

You will join the Growth Hacking team that consists of front-end and back-end engineers to work on different projects and technologies. You will craft pages on our website to meet the marketing goals quickly, refactor back-end and front-end code to optimize website performance, and be involved in a wide variety of short-term projects covering things like SEO, SEM, conversion optimization, content marketing, website information architecture, etc. You will collaborate with the teams on both edges of the spectrum, the CMS team that is responsible for the website engine and the Public Pages team that builds pages. To thrive and flourish in the Growth Hacking team, you will need an open but critical mind of an experimenter and a get-things-done attitude.

In the first week you will:

  • Go through the Developer Bootcamp to understand and integrate with our systems.

In the first month you will:

  • Be working on technical projects related to growth.

In the first three months you will:

  • Learn and understand growth at Toptal and how our projects relate to our growth objectives.

In the first six months you will:

  • Have a deep understanding of the levers of growth as it relates to the goals of our growth channels at Toptal.

In the first year you will:

  • Help evaluate and prioritize the projects that drive growth.

Requirements:

  • Experience as a front-end developer for 2-3 years with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
  • Experience as a back-end developer for 1-2 years, preferably with Ruby on Rails and PostgreSQL.
  • Knowledge of popular frameworks and libraries such as Bootstrap, Material UI, jQuery, Backbone, and React is a plus.
  • At least a year of experience with foundational developer tools such as git and shell, ssh.
  • An open but critical mind of an experimenter.
  • Appreciation for mostly short term project-based work and its benefits.
  • “Get things done” attitude.
  • Interest in web marketing, particularly in SEO, paid media, analytics.
  • Experience with e-commerce, advertisement, growth hacking, and conversion optimization.
  • Ability and interest in prototyping, exploration, and adopting new technologies.
  • You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.
Apply now

About Toptal

At Toptal, we value people for their contributions, not their time spent in a chair. We track goals reached, not hours worked, and we don't waste time in useless meetings. We are a completely remote company and foster a culture of relentless problem solving, direct feedback, and constant collaboration.

We analyze ideas rigorously, foster accountability, and have extremely high standards for everything we do. We are deeply invested in making sure Toptal is a place where everyone is continuously growing and learning.

Benefits

  • Remote
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Unlimited Vacation Days
  • No Mandatory Hours
  • Mentorship
  • Travel Any Time, Anywhere
  • No Office Politics

items.content:
Ads Specialist at Barrel Roll

Remote | Part-time

We’re seeking a Google Ads Specialist to join our team on a part-time basis. You will participate in strategy, planning, buying, and executing digital media campaigns on Google Ads and other advertising platforms. This is a part-time position with an estimated 20 hours per week to start. As it’s a remote position, you’ll be able to work from home or wherever you’d like!

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING

You will be involved in the entire campaign cycle from start to finish, determining budgets, strategy, optimization, and even helping to create and modify the creatives used.

We’re looking for someone with a hands-on work ethic that will edit campaigns manually rather than trusting automated tools to do their work.

You’ll be working on accounts for our clients and our own campaigns. You’ll work directly with clients and as part of our team. We’re looking for people who are fluent in English, both verbally and in writing, and who can expertly communicate solutions to clients.

More About What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Actively participating in digital strategy and media planning meetings
  • Creation of paid search campaigns from ideation to execution
  • Creating detailed reports of campaign performance
  • Performing keyword research and writing ad copy
  • Detailed analysis of account performance, providing advanced recommendations for optimization
  • Work with other team members to implement a cohesive and integrated strategy
  • Analyzing online media buys
  • Compiling daily, weekly, monthly, and lifetime reports to quantify the results and communicate them to management.
  • Staying informed with Paid Search industry best practices, new trends and technologies and platform updates (e.g. Google Ads, Bing, Facebook, etc.)

REQUIREMENTS

  • Google Ads Certified (Certification must be current)
  • A minimum of 3 years experience buying online media for direct response
  • Must be an independent contractor – we’re not interested in outsourcing work to an agency
  • Experience with building and managing a media plan
  • Proven track record of success in previous job (e.g. helped a client achieve X business goal; retained a client for X amount of time)
  • Preferred example(s) of success: Helped a client grow their overall profit with paid search and has the numbers to back it up, helped a client reach a target CPA/ROAS and has the numbers to back it up. ROI examples of 500% or greater strongly preferred.
  • Experience in native channels, Facebook, and/or experience with programmatic display
  • Extensive split testing experience and serving as a primary stakeholder for conversion funnel improvements
  • Experience with copywriting and writing copy for conversions. Provide examples and some of your best-converting copy
  • Digital marketing background is preferred
  • Understands basic marketing concepts (e.g. sales funnel)
  • Familiar with jargon (e.g. PPC, CPC, CPA, ROAS, bounce rate, pages/session, etc.)
  • Reliable, takes initiative and finds ways to solve problems independently
  • Passionate about developing knowledge and personal growth in Media Buying
  • Know the basics of media buying from both the client and media buyer’s perspective
  • Analytical – able to take data and identify trends, improve performance, solve problems, etc
  • Quick at learning; attentive to detail
  • Background and/or experience with design a plus (i.e Photoshop)
  • Working Knowledge of WordPress, HTML and CSS are pluses
  • Experience with CallRail, Slack, and Toggl are all valuable

BENEFITS

  • Competitive Market-based Salary
  • Work remotely with flexible hours
  • Two weeks of paid vacation
  • Flexible work hours
